Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	The words of Albuquisim begin here.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, sons, now I have completed this book for you, which is the final part of the science of medicine, since its completion has brought it to an end, and through its explanations and declarations, it is my wish that you may learn from this treatise, which is a part of surgery, carried out by myself.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the surgery done by me is spread out in our region and in our time, and it has been utterly privatized; so that the science of it is greatly endangered, and its practice is obstructed; and there remain only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have been altered more and corrupted into those errors and mistakes, until the intentions of it are closed off and the force of it and the art are exhausted.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is clear to me that you must revitalize that ancient order of this treatise through the method of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that the forms of the instruments of cautery and other tools of the work may be added to the declaration, and prepared for use, which necessity arises.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why a good craftsman cannot be found with his own hand in our present time is that the art of medicine is long and requires its actor to have been exercised beforehand in the science of anatomy, which was understood by Galen, so that he knows the joints of the members and their forms, and their conjunction and separation; and has knowledge of the bones, nerves, and ligaments, and their number and arrangement; and also of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the locations of their effusion.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore says Hippocrates that a name is not enough, but rather in small work and most of all in the art of one's hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said this about him in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not well-versed in anatomy as we have described it, will not be spared from falling into error by which many men are killed, just as I have seen many of those who are thus formed in this science and take themselves out of that without science or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For you saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor who had caused an abscess to form in the throat of a woman, and had cut some arteries in the throat so that a great deal of blood flowed, and as a result the woman died between them.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And you saw another doctor who ordered that a stone be removed from a man's bladder, which had progressed in his condition, and the stone was large, and he came to him and removed that stone with a piece of his own intestines, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you yourself had already appealed to remove it, and saw that due to the largeness of the stone and the condition of the patient, one could conclude above him that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And you saw another doctor who took payment from the duke of our land for surgery, and endeavored to set the fracture of a blacksmith's broken leg; but the doctor prepared it with his ignorance, removed the fracture above the wound with pulleys and astels with great tension, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he loosened it according to his desires, and then relaxed the bandage, and then loosened it again after some days and commanded us to loosen the bond; and thus it was that the leg and foot became gangrened, and came to destruction.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you were called to him, and I prepared to loosen the bond, and as a result he obtained relief and began to be freed from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But meanwhile corruption had already been confirmed in the member, so that it could not be restrained, and the corruption did not cease to spread through the member until the patient was in mortal danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And you saw another doctor who pierced a cancerous abscess and allowed it to ulcerate about three days later, until the great majesty of the disease overpowered his lordship.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which is because the melancholic humor is pure in the cancerous person, whereas it does not need to be brought forth by iron, but rather to be present in a member that suffers from being completely possessed.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation done by me be divided into two parts: one is in the operation which is associated with health, and the other is in the work where there is danger to the greater dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already existed in this place throughout this book where the operation is one of error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to keep this in mind and avoid that, so that foolish people do not get in the way of speaking and dishonestly besmirching your reputation.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your own arms with solicitude and the protection of God, and your patients with felicity and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best method through the grace of God to achieve salvation and glorious success, and overcome terrifying illnesses that are difficult to heal, and stand your ground with these arms that make you afraid, so that your position in your faith and in your name does not fail: for it is more remaining to your glory, and even more in this world and in the end to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Galen has said so in some of his own monodies:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"'Do not heal bad illnesses, lest you be called a bad doctor'".
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and the first part of the first chapter.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter, orderly arranged from head to foot, in the forms of instruments and iron tools for cauterization, and of what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on dryness and perforation, and on cupping glasses, wounds, and extraction of splinters and similar things, all chaptered and ordered in the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on curing of twists and similar things; chapter ordered from head to foot, and of the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cautery with fire and sharp medicine, and recalling of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that begins the treatise of this entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	You must say what quality the joints of that cautery have, and what are its defects, and in what condition it is prohibited to use cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the sermon on the quality of the joint of cautery and its defects is a long and prolix one, subtle in science, and hidden in secret; and many wise men have spoken about it, and they have disagreed among themselves, and to me it seems sufficient to present a small part of their sermons, fearing prolivity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery is suitable for all general conditions universally, which are in matter or of matter, except two conditions, which are hot humoral conditions.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the hot and dry condition with matter, it dries out; for some say that cautery is beneficial for this, while others say the opposite, that cautery is not suitable in a disease which is due to quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that a hot and dry disease, with water that is hot and dry, should be cured.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And say that which says the opposite of this, that through cautery, the joint is made in all hot and dry diseases that are found in the bodies of men, for when you compare the body of man and its humors to the condition of fire, you find the body of man cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the sermon of that, that this experiment has already been discovered to me on several occasions.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But it is not necessary that this come to light again about what has already been experimented and exercised in the chapter of cautery, and to understand the diversity of human conditions and the disposition of diseases in their respective members, and the causes of those, and the accidents of theirs, and the space of time for those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other conditions, there is no fear for you, and most especially in cold and humid diseases, for all doctors have agreed on those, and are not discordant about the joint of cautery in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, sons, that from the secret of healing through cautery with fire and its goodness, it is clear that those who use cautery with medicine are in error, for fire is simple, and its action only reaches the member being cauterized, not affecting another member connected to it except with slight harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of medicine combined reaches that member which is distant from it, and easily brings disease to a difficult-to-cure member, and easily causes harm.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, because of its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not do this except that it superfluously adds. And already we have known through experiment and long service in studying the art, on the truth of causes; and therefore I am excused from the length of the sermon. But if it were not for the fact that it is not read in a better book in this pause, to you, a secret hidden in fire, and the quality of the operation of it in bodies, and its expulsion by which it expels diseases, with a philosophical demonstration, which would be suitable for your souls.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that they disagree on the time in which it is convenient to do cautery and pause at the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient at any time, for the damage caused by the accidental time is submerged in the joint of this which is attracted to the cautery, and most especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and violent, which do not suffer delay because it is feared of those who come with malice, that is greater than a small harm entering through the time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus it is not considered in your souls, or, sons, that this is not esteemed by anyone but the common people and foolish doctors, so that to that disease which is cured by cautery, there is no reduction at any time, and they pause at the consequences.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not thus as they say for that reason, because cautery is nothing but in a place of medicine which alters the condition and dries up the humors which are the cause why pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But in any case, cautery is excessive over medicine because of the desire for its virtue and worthiness of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his disease will return at some hour of time, according to the condition of the patient and the location of his disease, and the virtue of it, and what is prepared in the body of him from the aggregation of superfluities in him, and what is obtained by him in his acquisition through foods and similar causes; except that the disease which is administered with cautery is a subtle disease in a few superfluities and humors, just like the cautery of the tooth for pain and similar to that, it is possible that in him the pain will not return, but rather it will be reduced in smallness.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And besides, the common saying is that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and it's a dreadful remedy, not to what they understand in it, because I believe that there is no cure that benefits by medicine or any other cause, approaching to cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and I understand that cautery is the last resort of medicine not at all when we administer the methods of healing in some diseases, and those medicines do not concur, and it approaches the end of the cause, then one administers cautery, and profits from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And hours ago I said that cautery is the last resort of medicine, not according to the understanding which I understand, and which the common people and foolish doctors also understand.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except by the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not make a difference, just as it is not absolutely true, for I have already proven and demonstrated that it does not do this except in some bodies or others, and cautery with gold is good and better than with iron just as they say; but however, when you do cautery with fire on gold, it is not declared to you, because it depends on the quantity that you want by the hardness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive heat; and if you adjust it above it, ignition occurs, and case some layers form so that the craftsman can see through the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And therefore, it is made to do cautery with iron in a way that is lighter and more proper for the rectitude of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have arranged this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have arranged those from head to foot, so that the one seeking it may easily find what they want.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On Caustics for Headaches caused by Coldness and Humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The First Chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization brings relief to the humidity and coldness on the service of the accident of which there are two causes: one cause is soda and multiplicity of fluxes, called corissa, from the head to the partitions of the eyes and ears that flow, and multiplicity of sleepiness, and toothache and gout, and universally all disease that comes through coldness, just as paralysis, stroke, and apoplexy, and similar diseases in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first, I command the patient to be purged with laxative medicine in the head, for three or four nights, according to what the virtue of the patient and their age and habit requires.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then I command him to shave his head with a razor, and then make that section sit between his own hands on a covered bench, and have him rest his hands on the stones.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the razor's stroke at the tip of your thumb, right above the nostrils between his own eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But when the above said location is reached, mark that location with a tent, and then light the cautery olive of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then pause that [cautery] on the marked location with the tent, in such a way that it descends gradually, as your hand is constrained little by little, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand slightly and look at the location, and if you see that some part of the skull has been uncovered, just like the amount of grain of errors, then lift your hand, and if it does not return to that iron [cautery], use another one, if it is chilled, until what I have told you is seen by the bone.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it on the location and let it stay for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then pause over it, covered with a cloth in the border and let it stay until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the location with four-part medicine until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when the wound remains open, so much the better, it gets the balm, because it is more suitable and beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them said that the tongue should be cauterized inside the bone, and kept there until some part of the specificity of the bone is absorbed.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then it should be removed from that which has been absorbed by the bone, and then it should be cured.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others said that with the cautery, it should be brought to the end, until it presses strongly on the bone, until the bone cracks, and this is the form of little alfalfa:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	and they think that from that location, the vapors of the head will be released.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the open wound should be kept for a long time, and then it should be cured until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But to me, it is not seen in these two species of cautery from all, except in some men according to the way of fear; and leaving that, I must say that it is better for health when it is so, because the head is revealed by the solution of continuity like we have testified in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of fierce nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first species of cautery is more saved and better, it seems to me; and with that house and that work, there is health.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	On Caustics for the Head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting pain occurs throughout the head in a patient who is prolonged in his malady, and uses of wars, warts, capillaries, poultices, emplasters, goutzes, cadels, and gualinas, and especially if it has already been cauterized with one cautery which relents and does not benefit the patient at all, then consider whether the head of the patient is of strong creation in his nature; and if it is not fierce and does not find great cold, then that other cauterizes another cauter, leaving a little bit.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize it on the crown of the patient's head with another cautery until the tongue is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the tongue and uncover the quantity of bone which we have recounted, and cauterize it with one cautery in the back part of the head at the location called "vas", -- and that is the location where a ventose is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And lift your hand away from there, and do not uncover the bone, because the patient by this will feel a great pain different from the pain of all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say that this cautery is in its place, because it needs the cautery with which you cauterize the crown of the head and the occiput is more subtle than that with which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is its form.
Capitol ters.	Third Chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On Caustics for Migraine Not of Ancient Origin.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When the patient has a headache in the back of the head, or it spreads to the eye, first purify the head with laxative medicines, and then administer the other cure which I have said in the divisions of diseases; and if none of these helps, then cauterization is done in two ways: either cauterization with acute medicine combined, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But the cauterization with combined medicine is when you take a small amount of aloes, and extract it and cut off the extremities of both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then cut the location of the pain in the temple with a well-sharpened knife until a small opening is made, leaving the tongue to be hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then strengthen it with a stopper pressed down by gradual constriction, and leave it for the space of three hours; and then remove the bandage and treat the aloes, and let the wound stay for two or three days, and then pause over it covered with a cloth until the location makes an opening.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with four-part medicine until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some combined medicines which I have written in the two treatises on combined medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cauterization with iron, according to this method: ignite for the purpose of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and is called "claw of nails", because the head of it is like a form of claw in which there is some curvature, and in the middle part of it is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then pause on the location of the pain, and hold your hand - so that the iron is not absorbed into the bone which remains - and slowly turn the small iron with velocity.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of bone that is absorbed by the specificity of the tongue is like the majority of bone, and raise your hand for this reason, so that the artery which remains is not absorbed, so that there may not be a flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak the cloth in saltwater and pause it on the location, and leave it for three days; and then remove the cloth with a border, and cure with four-part medicine until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize at the tip of the knife according to the caustic, and be careful not to cut into the artery in this non-ancient migrainous pain.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On Caustics for Ancient Migraine.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure migraine with what we have said about the previous cure and what we have said in the divisions of diseases, and if the cure does not work and the disease is so severe that it does not reach the amount we have said for the first cauterization with medicine or the cauterization with fire, then it is necessary to ignite the knife cauter until it is whitened, since you signify on the location of the pain with a line of length which is the majority of the finger, or what is that; and pause your hand for a moment and strengthen that until you cut into the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful about the continuity of the jawbone, which is damaged by mastication, and that the ligament not be absorbed and the nerves that are affected by it, so that there is no spasming.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is on the custody and caution of the flow of blood from the artery that is cut, because in the cutting of it there is fear, and especially to him who ignores what he does and is not studious and experienced; and leave the operation to begin.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will find in the remembrance of the regimen of blood flow accidental to the artery according to your method, in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this disease does not reach the cauterization and you see the patient's body is tolerable, then cauterize it in the middle part of the head just as we have recounted, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cauterization which we have said in the chapter on stretching of artery with two cauters, and this is the better cauterization and more suitable.
Capitol .v.	Fifth Chapter.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On Caustics for Earaches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain due to cold and it is cured with laxative causes and with the other cure which I have said in the division, and if the pain is not relieved, then ignite the cauterizer, and this is called "punctum", the form of which is:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then make the punctum and approach the ignition, and be carried around the entire ear like a wheel is rolled, or in the circuit of each example if the pain is in one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Hold the cauterizer at the root of the ear, little by little, until you have marked the location with intent.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cauterizer touches all the points in the entire ear, and those ones, and then cure the locations until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Sixth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On Caustics for Itching.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Itching which is cured and with cauterization is only of the species that comes from flux, according to what we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the species which occurs due to dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that species of itching with ointments and poultices and gualguaries, and your cure does not relieve the patient, then it is necessary to cauterize the patient with three cauterizers: one at the root of the ear, and the second a little below the temple, and the third at the conjunction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause your cauterizer on the contrary side of the affected part, because softening only appears on the part that seems to be healing.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize it with the cauterizer on the right side of the extremity of the ear, slightly above the crown of the head, and on the temple another, the length of which is according to the length of the thumb's joint, and pause your hand with the cauterizer until the quantity of the majority of the bone's specificity is consumed.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cauterizer, and it is a species of the knife cauter, the form of which is before us.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But meanwhile, it is more subtle that you see only a little of what I have said; and it is necessary to cut away the excessive roughness in it a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the location with water as is before the process, until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Seventh Chapter.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On Caustics for Ancient Apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and you cure it with the water which we have said and your medicine does not relieve the patient and the patient has no fever, then cauterize that with four cauterizers: on all the horns of his head; and with a cauterizer in the middle part of the head, just as we have said; and with a cauterizer in the occiput.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of cauterization is done according to what was said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And already it has been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is more posterior; and then be cured with water as proceeds.
Capitol .viii.	Eighth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On Caustics for Oblivion caused by Flux.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Make sure that the patient is given in the beginning large quantities of ointments and pills serving as purgatives.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the head of the patient and pause on the occiput of it an emplaster described in the treatise on emplasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And pause that for several days, because that is the manner of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the order which I have said before.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And therefore if it is good for those who are healed by this; and otherwise, then make three cauterizers on the posterior part of his head, which are descending from the uppermost part of the head to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And pause between each cauterizer the thickness of the finger, and then cure the cauterizer with water as has been done.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you add more and the patient is so tolerant, then make a cauterizer in the middle part; and if you wish to add even more, then immediately cauterize that on both horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	And then cure that until it is healed; and be the cauterizer olive-shaped according to the form given before.
Capitol .ix.	Ninth Chapter.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On Caustics for Paralysis and Softening of the entire Body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Make sure that you process in softening the head with ointments and water as we have said; and then shave the head of the patient, and immediately cauterize it with a cauterizer in the middle part of the head, and with a cauterizer on all the horns of the head, and with a cauterizer on the posterior part of it, and with three cauterizers on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the disease of softening of the body of many and the patients are tolerant and the disease is strong, then immediately cauterize that with four cauterizers on the vertebrae of the back, and afterwards with a cauterizer until it is burned through to the bone marrow, and lift up your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then cure that until it is healed, and this be an olive-shaped cauterizer.
Capitol .x.	Tenth Chapter.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On Caustics for Epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not cauterized the epileptic, but that epilepsy is caused by flux.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore, make sure to soften the brain of the patient at the beginning with ointments and other cure which we have said in the division when the disease is great and the patient is tolerant except for medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if the child cannot tolerate medicines, then administer gualguaries and mastigatories which serve to soften, for several days, with good nourishment of food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the head of the patient, and immediately cauterize it with one cauterizer in the middle part of the head according to the previous method, and another cauterizer on the occiput, and on each horn of the head, cauterize.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then immediately cauterize that with cauterizers which I say, having paralyzed and softened the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And be the cauterizer olive-shaped according to what has been said before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then pause with a subtle cauterizer according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Eleventh Chapter.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On Caustics for Melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are humidified, corrupted and fluxy in great abundance, then immediately cauterize that with the cauterizers which we have said in the preceding chapter.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is superfluity declining to melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then give him water that softens the brain of it according to what has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the head of the patient, and make a tortoise-shaped depression downwards from it on the circle, and then place that in the middle part of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be kept for six days, and be held from all parties.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then pause with an ointment; and it is more worthy of an old ram's fleece.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that over the fire with gentle warmth by measure, which the said patient suffered when he was in it.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then put that in the middle part of the head of him in the circle, and leave it until it is warmed through.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this with the patient for one week at a time, with another regimen of good until it is healed; or if you wish, cauterize that making small points according to what is most of it, but so that you hold your hand with a cauterizer thus ordered: this is a species of cauterization which moistens the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then pause that wrapped in a border or in gray gauze.
Capitol .xii.	Twelfth Chapter.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On Caustics for Water Descending into the Eye.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have declared the beginning of water in the eye by the signs which I have said in the division, then begin and give to drink to the patient water that softens the head of it, and guard against all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make that sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command him to shave his head, and cauterize that with a cauterizer in the middle part of the head; and immediately cauterize that with two cauterizers on both temples if it is the beginning of water descending into two eyes, or of one eye if it is the beginning of water descending into one eye.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut with a cauterizer all the veins and arteries that are left in the bone; and be the cauterizers in that long on the latitude of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of blood flux when it is being cauterized; and if you see blood flux from it, stop it with some medicine which is to your power.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And you will find wisdom in the extraction of arteries and in the ablation of those, and caution with regards to blood fluxes.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some times it is cauterized in the cervical vertebrae left between two bones with two cauterizers produced afterwards.
Capitol .xiii.	Thirteenth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On Caustics for Old Tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes are old and accumulated, and through the veins and arteries which are in the manifest location on the head outside, and it is verified that this is superfluous fluxy matter, then immediately cauterize that with a cauterizer which we have recounted in the chapter on the beginning of water flowing into the eyes, and with a cauterizer in the middle part of the head and with two cauterizers in the cervical vertebrae left between two temples, and with two cauterizers in the cervical vertebrae left between two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need addition, then immediately cauterize that on the entire breadth of the outer corner of the eye above the supercilium with a small cauterizer.
Capitol .xiiii.	Fourteenth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On Caustics for Bad Smell from the Nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that with water as we have said in the division and your treatment does not produce any benefit, then prepare and give to drink to the patient those cochias for three nights; and then shave the head of him, and cauterize it with a middle-shaped cauterizer and an olive-shaped cauterizer.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that with a clove-shaped cauterizer and two cauterizers on both superciliums, just below the hairline.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of not cutting into the artery lest you hurt it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And of the clove-shaped cauterizer, this is the form.
Capitol .xv.	Fifteenth Chapter.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On Caustics for Softening of Eyelids of the Eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or humidity, then immediately cauterize that eyelid with a cauterizer in this form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you wish, cauterize that on both superciliums a little with two cauterizers in all parts, and be them stretched out to the temporal areas.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And be the length of each cauterizer according to the quantity of supercilium.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cauterizer, but according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is softened.
Capitol .xvi.	Sixteenth Chapter.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On Caustics for the Eyelid of the Eye when the hairs are converted to the inner parts and punch the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye are converted to the inner parts in such a way that they pierce the eye, cauterize them according to two methods: either by burning or by medicinal concoction.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If with a cauterizer of fire, command the patient before this that he shall look at his hairs in such a way as those which are softening, until they are prolonged and equalized; and if you punch that, let him have their natural growth, then you strengthen the eyes of him with a bandage so that it may not be harmed until the hairs are born.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are born and equalized, pause the patient's head in your seat, and then signal on the eyelid of his eyes with a tent, with a sign which is according to the figure of a leaf of mirta, and be the beginning of the sign close to the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then wrap it in a cloth soaked with human urine or in mucus of papyrus on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then ignite the cauterizer of which this is the form:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize on the figure which is signaled, little by little, in many times, until the surface of the bone which is like a leaf of mirta, is completely burned through, appearing properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the sign of health for this work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the hairs of it being lifted above the point of puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave that for three days, and then pause on it with a cloth until the scar is raised.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that with an ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if some cause returns to the hairs for their natural growth and the eyelid is softened, then immediately do another time the cauterization on that just as you did previously.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are in the eyelid left behind, then immediately cauterize that until it is elevated to its natural place and equalized, so that the hairs do not pierce the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cauterizer with medicinal concoction is this: you command the patient to look at his hairs until they are prolonged and equalized, and then make a cloth of fabric in the shape of a leaf of myrtle.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take one ounce of known sulfur and one ounce of living vinegar. The end! And then take one ounce of known sulfur and one ounce of living vinegar. Mix those causes well, and make that with fasting so that it is not warmed; and then spread that water over the cloth which is made in the shape of a leaf of myrtle, and pause that on one eye or both eyes; and pause afterwards the eye cloth wrapped in human urine, and the patient's head be in your seat.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And then pause the said thing on the medicine and press it a little and do not harm it until the patient feels the stinging of the medicine, for stinging is in it as if from fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And then when the patient perceives that he is feeling stinging, then immediately stop the medicine and wash it with your said water; therefore, when the stinging ceases, then again wash the eye with water; and then consider if the eyelid has been lifted as much as it was washed away by fire or incision, for then you are well; and if not, return to that same spot with the medicine where you did not apply the medicine before, and do not neglect until your operation is equalized and the eye is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then pause on it with a cloth wrapped in a border until the bone of adjustment is eradicated; and then care for that with an ointment or another until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to be diligent in your operation, watching carefully that the medicine does not fall into the eye; and if the eyelid becomes softened after some days and some cause of the hairs pokes into the eye, then immediately repeat your medicine on that spot where the eyelid is softened, and do exactly as you did at the beginning, and approach it until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of leaf of myrtle.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyes of men are diversified according to their greatness and smallness, and therefore according to that is made your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And let not the way of righteousness be hidden from him to whom this art is studied in this book.
Capitol .xvii.	Seventeenth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On Caustics for Fistulas that are in the Lachrymal of the Eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure a fistula with water as we have said in the divisions of diseases and it does not correspond to your treatment, then consider that you must cauterize it according to this method: command the patient to pause his head in your seat, and hold the head of him some minister between your thighs in such a way that he is not harmed nor agitated with his own head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then wrap it in a cloth soaked in human urine or in mucus of papyrus on the eye of him.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cauterizer of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is curved, like a shape of cane or of a vulture's beak, from one end where the cauterizer is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it should penetrate to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish, it should be taken out like a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But in any case, the one that is curved is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and take out from it pus and dry up that one.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then immediately work on that and extract the discharge from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then pause on it the cauterizer which is well ignited, and take with your hand a little of the cauterizer from the eye to the nose, so that you do not err or the patient becomes troubled, and then pause the cauterizer in the gray of the eye and corrupt that one.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then if at the beginning of your cauterizer it enters into the bone, good is; and otherwise, immediately repeat the cauterizer one or two times, as needed; and leave that alone for three days, and then pause on that cloth wrapped in a border and surround it with an ointment to dry out until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if it is passed 11 days and it is not healed, then immediately pause on the sharp corrosive medicine until the bone is uncovered and shaved according to what is written in your own chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing a fistula which some earlier doctors also said: take the location of the fistula and fill it with it; and then pause in that fissure, subtle like this form: And pour into that the quantity of one ounce of melted lead; and hold your hand with a camal with good retention, and let not the patient be harmed because the melted lead does not reach the eye of that one; and it is necessary to pause on the patient's eye wrapped in human urine or water, for the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it through marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment, good is; and otherwise, it is necessary to administer a blow through the nose and reduce the fistula to the body of the nose according to where it will come into its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Eighteenth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On Caustics for the Cleft of the Palate.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times accidentally split fissures occur in the lips, and most commonly in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, since you cure those fissures with the water that we have said in the divisions and it does not take effect, then ignite the small cauterizer of a knife-shaped form according to this manner:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And be the curvature of it according to the subtlety of a scalpel.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	And then pause that instrument gently in those fissures until the cauterizer reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that with a cerate until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Nineteenth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On Caustics for Fistulas in the Mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or on the roots of the teeth there is an apostema and it grows, and breaks forth, and becomes antiquated, and a fistula forms, and you cure that one and it does not take effect, then consider that you must ignite the cauterizer according to the quantity received in the fistula; and then put that ignited instrument into the track of the fistula, and hold your hand until the hot iron reaches the bottom of it, and at the end of it make it thus one or two times; and then care for that with the water that we have said about treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And then if the pus is discharged and it is healed, good is; and otherwise, it is necessary to discover the location and uncover the corrupted bone according to what is written in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Twentieth Chapter.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On Caustics for the Teeth and Softening of the Gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are harmed, and you cure those with medicines and they do not take effect, then pause the patient's head in your seat, and immediately ignite the cauterizer of which this form comes close to, so that you pause the quill on the tooth and introduce into it the ignited cauterizer quickly, and hold your hand a little until the patient feels the heat of the fire reach the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift up your hand, and immediately repeat the cauterizer several times according to what you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient will rinse his mouth with saltwater and hold it for an hour, and afterwards stop, because the harmed tooth is closed, and the softened gum is strengthened, and the corrupted moisture is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Twenty-first Chapter.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On Caustics for Toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is due to coldness, or there is frost or vermin in it, or the treatment with medicine does not take effect, then consider that cauterization in that case is according to two methods: either cauterization with a border of cow's milk, or cauterization with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauteri am boder is that you take the border of cow's milk and boil it in a metal pot, then take a cloth and wrap it around the edge of the tent, and then immerse that boiled border in the cloth, and pause that on the painful tooth quickly until it is cooled.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then immediately repeat that several times until the virtue of fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, submerge a cloth or cloth in the border mentioned above, and pause that on the painful tooth, and then pause over that iron heated until the iron reaches the bottom of the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But in any case, the cauterization with fire is that you wait for the quill of iron or metal to be heated red-hot and in its heart there is some grooves, and the sharpness of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cauterizer in the shape that will come, and pause it on the tooth and hold your hand until the cauterizer is cooled; and do this several times until the pain is relieved or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.
