E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And corrosion is treated with acute medicines, because that is a means to cauterize.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But nonetheless, cauterization with fire is of greater benefit.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already said the cure for it with acute medicine in the division, and therefore take that when you will need it.
Capitol .liii.	Fifty-third Chapter.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On Cauterization of Nails and other similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Many times it happens that the parts left behind from the bad disease that is called nail, and it is a great cause, penetrating, which lames the foot; and cauterization in those areas is done according to two ways, namely cauterization with fire and cauterization with hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	But cauterization with fire is when you ignite the cauterizer with a concave shape similar to that of a vulture's beak, which is made of iron according to the quantity which contains the nail from all parts, and has subtle margins.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And immediately pause that ignited cauterizer on the nail, and immediately revolve your hand with the cauterizer in the circle of the nail until the cauterizer reaches the depth of the nail.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And release that area for three days until you begin to see growth.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And immediately apply that area with wild marjoram leaves mixed with salt, and release the application of the emplastrum on that area for one night, so that it may be eradicated from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And immediately cure that area with flesh-generating remedies until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and many times it happens so on the surface of the body, most especially in the muscles and bones, then it is good that you administer cauterizers with water; and this is done by taking a cannula made of earthenware or iron or beak of vulture, and placing it on the nail; and immediately pouring a small amount of hot water into the cannula, and retreating your hand, and revolving the area with compression of your hand all around, so that the margin of the cannula is pressed against the root of the nail, and allowing the hot water to flow slowly through the root of the cau; and waiting for the patient a little bit for the mordication of the hot water for an hour, and then releasing it, because the nail with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus do the same for those and then immediately apply the other to all of them as they are in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And immediately cure those areas where the roots of the nails have been eradicated with remedies that cause flesh to regenerate.
Capitol .liiii.	Fifty-third Chapter.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On Cauterization of Tremors.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When it happens that someone has a tremor due to constriction in the nerves or due to fever of a causing constriction, or for another similar reason, then it is good that you cauterize that area with four cauterizers or five on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra and one cauterizer; and on the feet of him, and on his stomach with olive cauterizer.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremors of him cease and hasten the healthiness of the constriction-causing disease.
Capitol .lv.	Fifty-fifth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On Cauterization of Accidental Pains in the Body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body there are accidental pains and pus-filled abscesses which are caused by gross corrupted matters; therefore it is good at the beginning as appears, that it should be cauterized on top of the fistula with a subtle cauterizer made of myrtle wood, the extremity of which is extended with fire; or with roots of long-lasting erestology; or with a lentecular cauterizer.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes it is good to cauterize at the beginning of their expulsion according to this manner; and do not believe, and it is interrupted the superfluity causing those things, and it cures those.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	But nonetheless, it is good that this be done with immediate evacuation through phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Fifty-sixth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On Cauterization of Blood Vessels Accidentally Cut by Artery Incision.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Many times it happens that the artery is cut which causes the wound to bleed profusely or causes the incision of apostemes or cauterization of a member, and then similar things happen, and it is difficult to stop that bleeding.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, when this happens to anyone, then you should immediately take a cloth with your hand and apply it to the orifice of the artery, and place on top of that the same method I have described many times until the bleeding of the blood stops and is no longer.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And immediately apply in the fire small and large olive-shaped cauterizers by number of pieces, and exhale upon them until they are made to be no longer.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And immediately take one small or one large of those olive-shaped cauterizers according to the location and wound where the artery is broken, on that vein which hastens more quickly than you have already cauterized the said, and apply it until the bleeding of the blood is stopped and reduced.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the orifice of the artery when you have removed the said and extinguished the cauterizer, then take another cauterizer carefully among those which are prepared in the fire, and thus do not cease to do this immediately until the bleeding of the blood is reduced.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful that you do not burn the nerves which are here, and that another harm comes to the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from the artery, then it is not possible to stop the bleeding in those places, and especially when the artery is large, unless with one of four methods: or with cauterization as I have described, or with extraction when it is not extracted, because when it is extracted the extremities are burned and the bleeding is reduced; or that it be tied with a thread or with a ligament by strong constriction, or that medications be applied to those places whose virtue is to restrict the bleeding; and be strengthened with pillows and decent constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who administers decent constriction to it with ligament and with strong constriction by means of cloths or by position of burning causes and similar things does not heal until later.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and there is no doctor present nor medicine, then do as I have indicated above on the orifice of that vein, and understand the great constriction of it until the bleeding is stopped from the highest part of the wound, and on the artery let it not be removed; and over the artery sprinkle with hot water of great coldness until the blood is congealed and thickened; and more carefully consider whether there is a need for cauterization or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	The second part begins.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	On Incision and Perforation, and Vents, and Phlebotomy, and Wounds, and their Similar Things.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all illness in which cauterization with fire is suitable and with medicine that burns, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments necessary in those things with the forms of the cauterizers; and we have organized the chapters of the subordination of the head to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And you will continue in this chapter in that same way, so that the one who wants to learn this will be illuminated, just as he has requested.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before you begin this, it is good, son, that you learn that in this chapter, it is for fear that it is in the first chapter of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for this, it is good that there be great caution in you, because in the operation which is in this chapter, many times evacuation of blood takes place, and which contains the life, and the aspersing of the vein or incision on the aposteme or warning of exit or purgation of the wound or extraction of arrow or incision of peyra and their similar things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And of all those, you are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in most of them, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I admonish you that this should not fall upon you in which there is situation, because sometimes the case demands from you methods of men with many methods of diseases.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And from them some will go away with their own disease and it is soon death for him, and thus by the vehemence of what he finds in his disease, and by the length of his disease, and with his disease there is fear which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And from them some will be given to your own child and said, you waiting for his health, and his own disease is pernicious.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore it is not good that you consent to him who comes to you with this method; and your caution be greater than covetousness and rapacity; and do not presume any cause over this unless absolute certain science which verifies this for you, and by which the praise-worthy success follows.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your illnesses prophesying and indication of that which is converted to health, for in that there is aid to you on the acquisition of fame and memory, praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, sons, God inspires His understanding in you and does not withhold direction and protection from you, for this is in His hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have organized this chapter into distinct chapters according to what preceded in the chapter on cauterization, from the cure of the head down to the feet, so that it may be alleviated for you that which you request and need.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	On the Cure of Water Which is Contained in the Head of Children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness often occurs in children during birth, and when the navel is tightened on the child's head it causes.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes it occurs due to a hidden cause that is unknown.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this illness except in children; and to all those whom I have seen, death has been imminent, and thus it has been shown to me that the work is laid out in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child whose head was filled with water had his head always thus magnified to the point where it could not be contained even by its own size; and more so that the moisture increased to the point of mortal fire.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this moisture either accumulates between the bone and the skull, or accumulates below the bone on the forehead.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	Therefore, the operation in that case where the moisture is between the bone and the skull and the aposteme is small, then it is good that you make an incision in the middle of the head with a fissure in the latitude, and let the length of the fissure be about two nights until the moisture flows out, and this is the form of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore, if the moisture is more increased and the aposteme is greater, then it is good that you make two incisions according to this method:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the moisture is below the bone, the sign of it is that you should lift up the commissures of the head from all parts and the water is pressed out when you compress that with your hand to the partitions inside and it will not be hidden from you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	It is good that you make an incision in the middle of the head with three incisions according to this method:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And immediately after the incision, extract all the moisture; and immediately strengthen the incisions with cloths and poultices; and immediately insert something on top with vinegar and oil within five days, and immediately remove the bandage and cure the wound with tents and poultices, and strengthen the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little moisture until the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision, which considers the magnitude of the aposteme and the collection of water, for sometimes it is more in the occiput, or in the front part, or on the right side, or on the left side; and therefore attend to the incision where the aposteme appears and the filling of water, and do so according to what seems best to you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not cut the artery, and if blood flows out and the patient dies from that flow of blood with evacuation of moisture.
Capitol .ii.	Second Chapter.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	On the Incision of the Arteries Which are Near the Ears, Called Hilassey.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When it happens that someone has catarrh or swellings on the eyes or feet, and this is old, and there is no hope in it for the cure of medicines, then the last resort in this case is the incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore it is good when you want to incise those that the patient's head becomes inflamed, and immediately make a rough cloth compress on the spot so that the arteries appear, and immediately strengthen the neck of the patient with some cloth; and immediately consider where the vein pulsates; and the places of each one over the places which are near the ears, are pressed down, and only in some men.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And immediately signal on the artery with a tent, and immediately incise each one with the spatula of each part, sharp as it approaches the bone, and this is done by the latitude of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you wish, enter the spatula below the artery and cut it at the points of incision on the parts above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be about two fingers' breadth, for when some vein is incised, the blood flows out with a pulsating gush, which springs forth by frequent jumps.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear at the incision, then it is good that you measure from the ear the quantity of space of three fingers' breadth, and immediately signal with a tent, and enter into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And as for what is to be taken from the blood, it is a quantity of vinegar one ounce. and as for what is to be taken from the blood, it is a quantity of vinegar one ounce, or more or less, and all this is according to the quantity which appears in the virtue of the disease and the filling of the artery of it.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And immediately consider the wound, and therefore if there remains on the bone any cause of the forehead, then incise it in order that it may not develop into a cauterized aposteme.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And immediately strengthen the wound with poultices and bandages of linen cloth, and immediately cure it with compresses until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Third Chapter.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the Extraction of the Arteries Which are in the Temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When some ancient or chronic disease is present in the temples, due to humidities and qualities of the lacertae, or old and vehement sores similar to those, and it has been medicated with the methods of medicinal cure, but this does not bring comfort, then we have recourse to the extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those similarly as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of the operation and extraction is that the patient scratches the skin where the arteries are located in the temples; and understand by the pulsation of the artery apparent on the temple, which is shown to you by its pulse, and is hidden from most men except for those with great fervor.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then the neck of the patient should be strengthened with some cloth; and immediately compress the spot with a rough cloth or evaporate the spot with hot water until the artery appears manifestly to you.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the spatula of which this is the form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then take the spatula of which this is the form: And immediately scrape the bone with that with ease until you reach the artery; and immediately cut into it on top and extract that from the upper parts until you extract that from the bone and uncover those beneath, from all sides.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is subtle, then immediately envelop it with the extremity of the oncus; and immediately incise one part of that according to the quantity by which the extremities of it are lengthened and contracted, and there will be no outflow of blood, for if they are not incised, the blood will not rise at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And immediately evacuate one ounce of blood. until three ounces.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then it is good that you divide it into two parts with a double fold of cedema or with strings at length, and do not let it putrefy before the consolidation of the wound and there is an outflow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And immediately incise the superfluity which is between two bandages; and do this in that hour or at another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize that with a cauterizer in the bone and with a cutlery-like cauterizer until the extremities of it are incised, and remain in that same place.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better work when the patient has fever or is of warm complexion; for cauterization is one of those causes that help to finish off the humidities, and therefore it is better in this case.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And it is good to immediately extract the arteries which fill the old cut with blood, and be paused over the decently made pulpits, and immediately be cured with dry medicines that make the flesh appear and become hard in order that it may be healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you are working another time the blood flow from the artery occurs, then immediately grasp to restrain that blood, or with a cauterizer, or fill the old cut, and strengthen your hand until the blood is restrained.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if any of these causes are not present before you, then immediately pause your hand on the spot until the blood is congealed, and insert the spot with hot water of great coldness so that the sharpness ceases, and be strengthened as needed.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And that which is more easily done in the extraction of an artery is that you cauterize the vein with this cauterizer having two blades, since you have marked the two spots with a tent, and each one, not ignited, until they reach the bone and incise the vein in two places, so that what is between the extremities of it may be lengthened, for they are not yet fully consolidated by this cauterization.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cauterizer:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the sharpness of the two blades is as follows.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But meanwhile if there is less sharpness than two blades are better, for if they are as keen as two blades near each other, and do not cut through the flesh with speed.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, as in those there is some thickness, it is held that the heat of the fire is in those and the flesh is cut away slowly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better than all works and more gentle.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the space which is between the two blades is equal to the thickness of the finger.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the Cure of Corneas with Sharp and Acid Lachrymation of the Eyes.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the tears are acidic, and the body of those veins which are above the forehead of the head is outside, and there is no comfort in this with any cause of medicinal cure, and the face of the patient becomes red and feels like a wandering march of ants, and the eyes of that person are exhausted, humidified so that the skin of theirs is congealed, and the eyelids are scalded by the sharpness of the tears, the ancient doctors mixed in the cure of those with this operation, and named that cure as "spassa".
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And it is that you command the patient to scrape the skin which is on his forehead, and immediately incise three cuts evenly distant along the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the incision is two fingers' breadth: one incision should be equally distant from the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a small movement of the lacertae which are in the lacrimal, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And beware of the incision of the arteries which are in two sides, and lengthen your hand from the continuation of both jawbones.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each incision is three fingers' breadth.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a sponge or cloth, well dressed and moistened with the liquid in which blood is congealed.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And immediately insert the spatula of two sharp extremities, the form of which is as follows:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the part of the temples to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape off all the bone that is between two incisions on the skull which is above the bone, and immediately do this from the first incision to the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And immediately grasp this spatula and insert into the first incision another instrument which is called a cutlery, sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And pause the blade of that instrument so as to cut through the attached flesh and bone, and the edge of it should lean inward towards the bone, and push it forward until it reaches the middle incision, and cut away with it all the vessels that descend from the head to the eyes.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But continue the incision up to where it appears on the bone, and immediately do this in the middle incision until it reaches the other incision.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And when the quantity of blood that has been extracted is equal, press out the places where the vessels of the congealed blood are located.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And immediately pause in each incision a cut of old cuttlebone, and pause over those pulpits filled with vinegar, oil, and vinegar mixed together, so that there may not be an outflow of cauterized aposteme.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, remove the bandage and administer great abundance of hot water or bathing, and immediately cure it with a compress of basil and rose oil, and other things until the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Fifth Chapter.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the Cure of Lachrymation through Cautery and to the Eyes descending from the Parts outside of the Head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When certain veins are cauterized and continue, and the eyes of the patient are exhausted and small, and their regard is debilitated, and the eyelids ulcerated and their skin dry, and in the forehead of the head there is sharp pain and subsequent exhaustion, then you should know by these accidents that the matters and cauterization do not come from many veins of the parts outside but proceed.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure in these cases is this: that you command the patient to scrape his forehead, and immediately incise a cut at the middle of the forehead, a little off-center (and it begins from the incision of the left temple to the right temple; and the incision is into the bone; and lengthen your hand over the lacertae of the temples which are more towards the mastoid process), until the bone is uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry out all the blood with a sponge or cloth, and immediately fill between the two lips of the incision with old cuttlebone or cloths dipped in vinegar.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And immediately press down upon those pulpits filled with vinegar and oil, so that there may not be an outflow of cauterized aposteme.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you have removed this and see that the aposteme is diminished, then it is good to press upon the bone until it begins to appear as flesh, and immediately cure it with an emplastrum exsiccatiu which makes the flesh appear, just as if you took two parts of wheat flour and four parts of colophony and mixed them together, and from this make a poultice and administer it in these wounds at the time of the natural birth of flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Sixth Chapter.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the Cure of that which Catarrhs in the Ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The total cause that catarrhs in the ears is one of four species, for either it is mineral pyrrhea or a similar cause like iron and verdigris, or it is from plant material like cypress or fava, or it is a fluxible cause like water and vinegar mixed together with their likenesses, or some beast.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore, when pyrrhea or another similar cause that does not agree with the ear catarrhs in the ear, and pause the ear at the sun, and if sometimes the pyrrhea appears, then immediately distill some oil of violet or samama into it, and administer the extraction from there, and make the stornutation according to condition, and block the nostrils beforehand by the event of stornutation.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And immediately pause in the cavity of the ear some cloths or wool, and stretch the ear to the parts above, because many times it is forgotten with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if not, then immediately administer the extraction from there with the instrument called gestae epicicarios, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if forgotten with gestae, be it so; and otherwise, immediately administer the extraction from there with a subtle onyx of few duplications.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore, if not forgotten by this, then immediately make a needle of iron and insert the extremity of the needle into the hole of the ear and close around the needle with wax and softened oil so that only the needle is left.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And immediately extract the instrument with strong attraction, for too many times as we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if not forgotten in this manner, then immediately take a halved light or a prepared vessel with which the hawks grasp a small quantity, and pause that in the extremity of the ray, and immediately envelop it with a decently placed cut.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And immediately insert that into the hole of the ear with ease, and immediately dry out the ear from its humidity.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore, if not forgotten with all the causes which we have recounted, then you should cut it down before it becomes cauterized or spasmed.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of cutting it down is that you first bleed the patient from the saphena vein and extract the blood according to the virtue of the matter, and immediately make it cease between your hands and convert the ear to the parts above, and then make a small incision in the root of the ear at the location where the grey matter is previously prepared.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And the incision should be of lunar shape until it reaches the pyrrhea, and when the pyrrhea is blackened, stop that if you can with suitable instruments; and immediately close the incision at that hour with speed, and cure that so that it may be healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause that afflicts the ear is one of the fat things that increase and are inflated, then immediately administer the cure and extraction from there; but if it does not obey your command to come out, then you take a spatula of fine tin according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer with that the cutting away of that fat thing which is fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not make it when you think that it has already been moistened by the vapor of the ear, and pause it in many places, and then immediately extract it from there with onyxes or subtle gestures, or with incision as we have said, for it is alleviated the extraction from there.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water that has entered the ear, it is good for the patient to use stornutation according to condition at first, and fill their own ear with a little old cuttlebone, and then place a stone above that ear where the water is, and if forgotten, be it so; otherwise, take many sharp iron points and lemons of the same length as the finger, heat them in the fire for a while, and then have the patient insert one of those into the hole of their own ear and strike another point on the stone that is opposite the ear where the water has entered.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore, do not cease until all the water has been forgotten.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And already the water will be forgotten in this way that you take a piece of paper or parchment. and place one end of it in the ear and stretch the other end over the fire until the middle of it is burned.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	and immediately place another piece of parchment and make it so many times until all the water is forgotten, and extract that with a needle as we have said above regarding the extracting pyrrhea.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But if in the extraction of beastiness that enters into that ear, it is a small thing, like this and similar, cure that as we have said in the division; but if it is from great body which appears on the sense of the vessel, then immediately administer the extraction from there with gestures and onyxes, and the cause of it is more gentle than all the other causes that afflict the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But if in the extraction of vermin generated in the ear, when you cure that with what we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillations, and your cure does not take hold, then it is good for you to gaze at the ear towards the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore, if any cause of the worms appears here, then immediately extract that with gestures or subtle onyxes; but if no cause appears, then take a needle made of straw and broad at the top of which this is the form:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the subtle end into the ear according to the quantity that the patient can tolerate; and immediately suck out with it a strong sucking motion, and do this many times, until all the worms are forgotten.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if it does not obey your command to come out, then you should block and close the circuit of the needle with wax as we have said; then immediately administer distillations which have already been tried by the ancients in the cure of worms, and you will find this in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And be your effusion with which you pour the medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument of which this is the form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make that of silver or iron, made from straw, with a small hole in it and a flat top.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And thus be as they pour into the cavity of the needle's container, here where it is necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the ray and wrap it around the end of the needle decently cut, and immediately drop oil into the cavity of the ear, or juice from some herb, or what you want from these medicines in the needle — and that is in the ear —, and immediately insert the ray with a cut above and press it gently with your hand on the compression of the matter so that the oil is expelled into the cavity of the ear and the patient feels the oil flowing out.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what is inserted in the ear has already been heated by fire for a little while.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And be careful that the cause which you distill into the ear is not too hot, for the medicines of the ear cannot endure this.
Capitol .vii.	Seventh Chapter.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the Cure of Obstruction of Ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes certain children are born with the vents of their mothers not perforated, and this already happens in some men, obstruction in the meat of the ear due to a wound or flesh not having been there; and this obstruction sometimes is made in the forepart of the trunk of the ear which does not consent to the vessel, and sometimes it is in the outer parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the forepart of it, which does not comprehend the vessel, is in the most difficult dispositions for cure.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And when you succeed in comprehending the vessel, it is good that you pause the ear of the patient to the sun and gaze at it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore, if there is an evident obstruction, open that with a subtle spatula of which this is the form:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the end of it is in which there is a small latitude, where one part is acute and the other not; and the spatula is two-edged like a lion's tooth, for so that it does not cause harm to the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And therefore, if the obstruction is due to flesh born in the ear or in the meat of it, then you should extract that with subtle onyxes and cut through that with a vehement ease until all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the obstruction is in the forepart of the ear, then you should take a subtle iron ray and heat it slightly with fire, and immediately place that into the meat of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore, if you have detected obstruction by that which the patient finds with ease, due to gravity of hearing, force the oppression of it with ease; and be careful not to harm the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And immediately pause in the ear with cloth of linen according to the quantity of the width of the hole which you have wrapped around it with Egyptian ointment; and do this for some days until you are sure of the consolidation of the wound; or take some white lead and soak it in water and powder over it, followed by use; and if the ear has already become apostemated, then it is good that you remove the lead and replace it with another lead which you wrapped around it with rose oil, until the aposteme becomes calm; and immediately cure that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if bleeding occurs, then immediately immerse a sponge or cloth in hot water and pause it over the ear, and use the other cure which restricts the flow of blood, which is said in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Eighth Chapter.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the Cure of Athelis which affect the Eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athelis which afflict the eyelids of men sometimes are humid, and at other times dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, it is good that you take those with ten-handles or onyxes, and incise them with an spatula of the roots, and immediately pause over the places as said.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if pain accompanied by bleeding comes, then you should cauterize those with a lunar cauterizer of subtle onyx.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is to do it immediately after the incisions and many times return when there remains some cause of their roots; and when they are cauterized by fire, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Ninth Chapter.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	On the Cure of Grandessia which comes to the Eyelids of Men.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Many times it happens that in the eyelids of men some cause arises which is akin to Grandessia in its strength and hardness, and because of this Grandessia is called.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick moisture on the eyelid below and above.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation in them is that you should consider whether Grandessia is proceeding from there on the eyelid and is manifesting on all sides; and the cause of it is light.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, make an incision on that with a fissure by the latitude, and immediately cut it off from all sides with ease; and immediately suspend it with an onyx and cut off the excess.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if your instrument is not prepared, or if you are only able to penetrate the eyelid with an incision little by little, then this will not help in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you should adjust it with a suture; and cure that until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, then you will not suffer harm from it because the ointment of it restores that and enfleshes.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if Grandessia is declining towards the outer parts of the eyelid, then you should remove the surface outside, and immediately ease the eyelid and suspend Grandessia with an onyx, unless you are forced to make an incision; and press that from all sides, and if the eyelid through incision is lengthened, this will not help in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And immediately after the incision, wash the eyes with salty water; and cure the place with that which enfleshes until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Tenth Chapter.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	On the Cure of Axcirnach in the Eyelid above the Eye.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Axcirnach is a grayish substance which is generated in the tunic of the eyelid above, and more often affects children, aggravating their eyes and causing them to weep; and they cannot look at the brightness of the sun because tears are shed upon them.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And for this reason you must always wet their faces and sleep on their faces, so that the eyelids of theirs below are covered with humidified skin, which has already been inflamed, and there is imminent danger of apparent inflammation in the eye; and when you press the place with those words, you will cause inflammation within them.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And some manner of operation is in that which the patient places their head on the tie and you immediately place a cloth of linen and oil there, making a calque, and make from it a circle according to the quantity which contains Axcirnach from all sides, and immediately place that upon that and press with those words so that inflammation may be aggregated in the middle of the circle, and immediately end in the middle of that humidity with a spatula incised with a fissure by latitude, and the fissure not be greater than the one made in flautobotomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the forepart it is good that you make a cut all around until you reach the inflammation, because in the most desperate cases, inflammation proceeds by fissure according to the form of white grayseness.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, extract that with cloths which you have wrapped between the said ties to the outer parts and revolve it between your right and left hand until it is scattered.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to insert into the fissure, lest with the spatula you do not reach the eye and disturb it.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if there is no appearance of Axcirnach at the beginning of the fissure, but rather you adjust into the fissure a little with ease, so that Axcirnach may proceed; and immediately extract that as we have said; and immediately submerge cloths in water, vinegar and powder, and pause those over the place and strengthen them with polvils.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And thus some will trickle salt and pause it in the cavity of the fissure, so that what remains of that humidity may be dissolved.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And immediately cure that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if there is an apostemate in the place which becomes calm, then you should cure that with soft plasters until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Eleventh Chapter.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	On Methods of Touching the Eye.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyelids of men there are born natural folds, and so becoming antiquated, then they no longer touch the eye and cause methods of illnesses such as constant tears and softening of the eyelids and skin, until this becomes a cause of destruction of the eye which is called touching the eye, and it is cured in four ways: or by cauterization with fire; or by acute medicine according to what has been said before in the chapter on cauterization; or by atactini made through incision and suture; or by canna according to what I will say.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And therefore it is good that you pause the head of the patient in the tie; immediately convert the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is converted, then it is well; and if not, insert a needle into that part which is nearest to the edge of the eyelid on the side where there are no hairs - namely, among the hairs themselves - and make the needle penetrate above, and thus - near the margin of the eyelid - pull out the thread to the upper parts with the eyelid, and convert it with a ray.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And immediately end in the outer part of the eyelid below the hairs with a spatula incised with lacrimal major into the lacrimal minor; and immediately extract the thread and pause below the eyelid with small powder or cloth, and immediately shut over the eyelid with a tent, and it will be thus as the figure of myrtle leaves.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But nonetheless it is good that the figure be according to the quantity of elevation of the eyelid, because this has already been diversified in men, since some of them require that a great quantity of the eyelid be incised according to the quantity by which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And immediately end with the spatula on both lines which you have drawn, and begin from the lacrimal major into the lacrimal minor.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is like the natural folds as they are in the king's beard.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And immediately place the onyx in one of the two angles of the wound, and immediately extract all that, and adjust with a suture the two lips with a gulf or fine woolen thread, and absorb the blood, and make adhere what is superfluous from the threads to two eyebrows with some perceiving causes; if you wish to do so, and otherwise, do not cure.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And immediately loosen the thread of the threads within three or four days, and immediately cure that.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, leave the wound without suture, and cure that with what dries up and constricts, because the eyelid is elevated by the sealing of the wound and its aggregation; but suturing is better. And thus I say to those who came before me to taxine.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But nonetheless in him there is solicitude for the patient, and it is of good operation, and not in him fear.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And it is another manner in taxine, and it is that you mark on the eyelid a figure as of myrtle leaves, and immediately elevate the eyelid with three unctuous substances separated and congregate according to this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if it is not possible to have the unctuous substances, and this is not equalized, then take a needle with thread and insert it into the middle of the figure, and enter the other thread alongside the lacrimal major, and the second thread alongside the lacrimal minor, and adjust between the said ties the threads with equality, and immediately elevate your hand with elevating motion, elevate all the wound over which is marked as we have recounted.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And immediately adjust the two lips of the wound with a suture, and cure that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if there occurs an apostemate because of your incision or your fissure, then calm that apostemate with cerote and oil-like substances, and with gentle remedies.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes it happens that the eyelid is converted so that its hairs are turned, then it is good that you use in that what we have said about incision; but suture in each case is more artificial.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Atactining with canna is according to this form:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	and it is that you convert the eyelid and cut out the figure which is outside according to what I have recounted; and immediately make two cannae or two fine astals, the length of which is according to the length of the eyelid and the latitude of which is less than the latitude of the spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already incised at the extremities of each part, where you have the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	And immediately add each one with subtlety on top of what superfluously protrudes from the eyelid of the eye, and constrict the cannae of each part with a very tight stricture, and leave it for some days, because the wound will die and become denuded and will fall inwards as it slowly descends.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it is delayed, then tear off the threads, and immediately cure the wound until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Therefore, when it is solidified, the eyelid is elevated and the hairs do not prick.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the form of two cannae which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and have the quantity of length and latitude neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Twelfth Chapter.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	On the Elevating of Pricking Hairs in the Eye with a Needle when the Hair is Hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the hairs are unnatural, hard and rough, and prickly to the eyes, the operation in that is that you take a fine needle and pause it in that delicate thread of silk or wool, and immediately adjust the extremities of it so that they fit together in a manner most subtle.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And be the length of the threads of the quantity of one palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And immediately compose another fine thread below it in brief, and tie the extremities of that if you wish.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And immediately place the patient's head in the tie and it be proper for the sun, so that your work may be declared, because it is a subtle and minute operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And immediately insert the needle into the root of the adjusted hair which has required engineering, and make it penetrate into the eyelid rapidly until you extract it above the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And immediately pull out the hair upwards and insert it into the alloy, and be the hairs one, two, or three, but not more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And immediately pull out your hand with that until the hair is extruded and alloyed in the eyelid along with the natural hair.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.
