But if the alloy is attracted and not expelled the hair, you will attract the alloy to the parts below along with the thread which you have composed there, until it is expelled above the superfluous part.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And gaze at that with the vision of the eye, because then you will expel the alloy and the thread, and grate all and close the eye, and leave the closures for two or three days, until the hair adheres to its place and grows well on top of it.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the hair is too short, then you adjust one long hair from the natural hairs, and it is elevated with that, or let it be until it grows to a suitable space, and then you elevate that.
Capitol .xiii.	Thirteenth Chapter.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	On the Cure of Echachration which appears on the Eyelid above.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When there appears in the eye Echachration, which is contraction of the eyelid when it is contracted on one side or the other, either above, below, to the right or left, due to bad consolidation of a wound or section or cauterization, and it is called Leporina, and this Echachration either occurs naturally or accidentally, and it is caused by consolidation of a wound or sections or cauterizations, or by resemblance to their maladies.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The manner of the operation in this is that you open up that consolidation and separate the lips of it, and pause within it a piece of linen cloth, and bind those together until they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And it is not good that you use a cure for this of the causes which dry up and constrict; because if you do so, it will return to echachration worse than never had any.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use in that a cause which softens, such as fenugreek, and mix with the water in which it is cooked, or with a gentle poultice of aquilon, which is liquefied with some of the oils, and submerge the cloth in that, and cure with that.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the treasure of your cure is that you perforate with all artifice that is not consolidated according to the form which it had at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have said, is nothing but some correction of echachration that does not return to the form of the place as it was before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Fourteenth Chapter.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	On the Cure of Echachration which is made in the Eyelid below.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This echachration which is made in the eyelid below, which is truly called vertadierament echachration; and it is either of natural or accidental origin.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	But accidental is made by wound or section or cauterization or other similar things.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way of the operation is that you take a needle with double thread, and put it into the flesh, and make it pass from the left lacrimal to the right lacrimal, until the thread reaches both extremities of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	And immediately extend the flesh to the upper parts with the needle and sew it with the needle, and incise with a spatula broad.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And therefore if the figure of the eyelid returns as it should, it is good; and otherwise, take a ray and pause it in the cut figure, and with that convert the eyelid, and close the two incisions on the underside of the eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And be the extremities of the two incisions at two angles of the incision which you have made, where they converge, and be of their own making an angle, so that when they come together, a figure is formed by them.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is the Greek letter lambda (λ).
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And immediately stop the flesh there by the quantity that is the thickness of the eyelid below, so that it may be cut.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And immediately adjust the separated parts and sew those with a thread of wool; and immediately cure those with what we have said about softening medicines and poultices, until it is healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if echachration occurs due to fissure or suture or cauterization, then it is necessary that you open with a flat incision on the hairs of the eyelid according to what has been said before.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And immediately separate with a poultice between two lips according to what we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the sum of the sermon on the cure of echachration when it is above or below, let the operation run its course according to what has been prepared in the form of echachration, and that is in the form of various modes.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the skilled artisans prepare artfully in every manner possible for each case, so that they may return the figure to its natural form or almost, and that patient according to what is convenient for the operation and the instruments in the greatest dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Fifteenth Chapter.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	On the Adherence of the Eyelid to the Conjunctiva or Cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation occurs in many men, it is necessary that the eyelid be solidly fixed above on the album of the eye, and prohibited from the ease of movement and its natural works, therefore it is necessary that you enter the extremity of the ray below the eyelid, and raise or extend it upwards with an unguent.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And immediately you incise the adherence with a spatula subtle, which is not sharp-edged, having a obtuse small part so that the patient may not be troubled by the operation, and leave the spatula so that it does not injure the eye in its subtlety.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And be your incision such that it excises that adherence with facility, so that the eyelid may return to its natural form and all the adherence may be healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And immediately you put in the eye salted water with which you wash, or distill into it zymic substances dissolved in water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And immediately separate between the eyelid and the eye with a poultice of wool, and pause on the eye lanolin infused into the albumen of egg whites, and immediately use for three days causes that consolidate until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Sixteenth Chapter.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	On the Incision of the Ungue and Eminence of Flesh of the Lacrimals.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that the ungue is according to two manners, because it is either nervous, similar to a hard and subtle cipha, or non-nervous, similar to white congealed humidity, which when it touches iron, or is forced to take on oil, it is abscinded and the oil is not fixed in place.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both species do not begin until the lacrimal major, which gradually covers the vision and prohibits light and movement of the eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	But the manner of working in this incision is that the patient puts their head in the tie and you immediately open the eyes of them, and elevate the eyelid with your hand, and immediately collect the ungue with oil of little duplication and extend it to the upper parts.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	And immediately take a needle and enter it into that ungue with a horse or ox or cow hair, or similar thread, or a strong thread, doubling the extremity of the needle little by little and placing it in the middle of the ungue, and penetrate it with the needle, and tie it with thread to the ungue; and extend it to the upper parts, and excise on the side of the ungue which is before the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And thus you follow that with the hair until the end of it.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And immediately you incise the remaining part at the root of the lacrimal with a subtle spatula or small forceps, and lift up the natural flesh of the lacrimal so that by this incision there may not be continuous flows of tears.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes the ungue with its extended oil or thread, as we have said, and immediately it is excised with a lion's spatula, the form of which is this:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And be careful that with the spatula you do not touch the corneal tunic and cause a rupture in it, and that the pupil is perforated.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And immediately the incision causes in the eye a little salt to be extracted or made from the juice of the sinic tree, and leave it until the next day; and immediately cure that with water as needed until it is healed.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the ungue is not nervous and you cannot insert the needle, nor is it fixed with oil in that place, then many times this species of ungue is cured by medicines, and is healed thus as I have said and recounted in the division.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you want to incise that, then you work on the eye of the patient and take a subtle lion spatula with keen edge according to this form:
am subtilitat.	with subtlety.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if sometimes it is rarefied and is confused and enters into its root, then you distill from your own sight into the eye of sinic tree or with rose petal or with salted salt, and anoint the eye until the next day.
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	And immediately iterate over that the operation until all that is of it is remade, except that the contrary apostema may be in the eye, because then you leave it, and cure the apostema at the beginning until it is healed.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	And immediately iterate your operation on that with reason until it is healed.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	The Eminence of the lacrimal flesh, if noted in the eye for great harm, is suspended with oil; and you incise that from one part, and do not complete the incision so that you may not excise continuous flows of tears.
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	And immediately distill into the lacrimal rose petal and sinic tree until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Seventeenth Chapter.
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	On the Incision of Algae and Water that is born from Adjusted Flesh in the Eye.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Sometimes in the eyes of some people there is born red flesh, and it is overgrown to cover the pupil, or approaches or strengthens above the eyelids and firmly compresses the eyelids against the parts outside and is assembled like a rose of balcony.
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	But the operation in this is that the patient puts their head in the tie; and immediately opens the eyes of that and collects all that flesh with suitable oils and water, and then anoints it with a forceps or with a basket; and immediately incises the flesh at the beginning until everything is finished with the encisor, and be careful not to injure the eye by your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And be your incision with which you incise those or with spatula which we have recounted in the incision of the ungue, or with small forceps with which is collected according to the form that will come to this chapter.
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	And then when your incision is completed and all that flesh is remade, immediately fill the eye with salted salt, or distill into it red powder and resembling those of corrosive medicines, and pause on the outside of the eye covered with albumen of egg whites until it is ensured against apostema caution.
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	And if there remains some cause of algae and is sealed with caution, and you fear apostema caution, then immediately leave the eye alone and cure that apostema with water that will heal that apostema, and immediately iterate over it with operation until it is healed, and similarly do in the adjusted flesh which occurs in the eye of this species.
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	But however, you must ensure that the entire cure of the eye is through natural or accidental means, and not with iron, and do not put your hand in any of these operations until you see that member being sufficient for that operation.
Capitol .xviii.	Eighteenth Chapter.
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	On the Collection of Scales on the Eye.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Scales which come forth red and rough on the eye and prohibit its operation, and disclose the eye with the length of days.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	Therefore it is necessary at the beginning that you consider whether the eye in which scales are present is strong and there is no other illness except scales, then you collect those scales.
E es que tu comandes al malaute que pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop suspen aquelas venas am un onci o am dos segon la tua prudencia; e sia aquel onci de subtil duplicacio segon aquesta forma:	And it is that you command the patient to put their head in the tie and immediately suspend those veins with one or two oils according to your prudence, and let that oil be of subtle duplication according to this form:
o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or two oils gradually mixed together in a vessel according to this form:
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	And immediately those veins are collected with subtle forces, with subtlety, and washed hour by hour, until you see those veins being remade from the eye and turned back.
E guarda te que tu no ledes le huel am las extremitatz del spatum; e si’ la tua operacio en le miegjorn denant le solelh, e sias mot ferm en la tua operacio que no inscidas sino aquelas venas.	And be careful that you do not injure the eye with the extremities of the spatula; and if your operation is in the middle of the day before the sun, and be firm in your operation that you only incise those veins.
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel.	And when you have completed, immediately you distill into the eye green or red powder so that with its keenness it may corrode the water that is remade from the scales.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	But if this is not possible for you, collect everything in that hour, and immediately apply all the water that relieves the pain of it, and leave it for some days until the pain of it is calmed down and it is ensured against caution.
E aprop itera sobre lu segon que la mateyssa manieyra entro que sia sanat.	And immediately iterate over it in the same manner until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de las forfexs:	And this is the form of the forceps:
Capitol .xix.	Nineteenth Chapter.
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	On the Reduction of Nasal Discharge to the Nose.
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you cure nasal discharge with cauterization or acute medicine, as it is preceded by the narration of it and is not healed, then do not intervene in it except that you make an incision over the apostema until its maturity, and extract all the moisture which is in it and pour it into a container until the bone is revealed.
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then when the bone is revealed and corruption or blackness occurs in it, immediately you scrape it with an instrument of which this is the form:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	And it is called the "Asper Cap", and is made of iron, and has a head rounded like an asher that is made pointed by lime or aliskalfati for subtle punctation (such as it is in this form).
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	And pause that over the corrupted part of the bone, and immediately rotate it between the said ties, and press your hand little by little until you know that corruption is scraped.
E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	And then it is done several times, and immediately restore the place with causes of drying and purging.
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	Therefore if the place is consolidated and good flesh has grown in it, and the body of the pus has been removed and there are no more than 40 days, and it does not renew itself nor become apostematized, and no accident occurs in it, then you will know that it is healed.
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	And if not, then immediately do not intervene in it except to reduce the fissure to the form of the nose, and according to this manner: and is that you uncover the second bone with iron or acute medicine, and when it is uncovered, then you take a trip according to this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Be the extremity of the iron triangular, and the shaft of it be first exhausted up to the extremity thus as it is sometimes.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	And immediately pause that over the bone, and be it close to the lacrimal; and lengthen your hand a little from the eye, and immediately turn your hand with the trip until it penetrates all the bone, and that feels the patient by sensing that something is going to come out through which they are going to feel pain.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Therefore immediately restore the place with purgative medicines that dry, just as if it were a poultice.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	Therefore when the flesh and the place are hardened, immediately the material that was flowing to the parts outside returns to the nose, therefore it is easier on the patient.
Capitol .xx.	Twentieth Chapter.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	On the Reduction of the Eminence of the Eye.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the eye eminences to its total height and there is no accident or diminution in it, then you must loosen the patient, and immediately follow, and pause for vaporous breathing in the cervix without scarification and suck well; and immediately pause over the eye with a liniment made from acacia, aloe, and sarcocolla, and strengthen the poultice on the eye with many powders.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the manner of the powders is that you take cloths of lion's mane, and each cloth be duplicated into four folds; and make powder from those.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And immediately pause those one on top of the other according to the quantity which the eye needs.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	And immediately strengthen on those with a cloth of hard and strong texture; and iterate the bellows with suction without scarification; and immediately stop the bellows and leave the eye straight for the day and night.
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	But if in the meantime the ligament is softened, then you must immediately make it tight.
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And immediately stop the ligament at the day and night as we have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if the eye is already reduced, good it is; and otherwise, then immediately repeat the poultice with powders, tightening and bellows until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Twenty-First Chapter.
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	On the Incision of the Eminence of the Uveal Tunic.
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	When there is a disruption in the uveal tunic and it is elevated and proceeds outside the palpebras like a grain of raisin, and its shape resembles that of a man due to this, and you want to incise it, then the operation in it is done as we have recounted, which is that you insert the needle into the root of the uvea from the part left and the part above, and immediately put the other needle into the double thread of the lacrimal part, and make that penetrate and leave the first needle according to its disposition; and immediately incise the location of the double thread and lift with it the part of the uvea in the circuit of the needle, and strengthen it firmly.
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	And immediately extract the needle and pause over the eye with lanolin infused in egg whites, and leave it until the thread dissolves into the uvea.
E aprop cura le huel am aquo que conforte aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And immediately cure the eye with water that comforts it until the wound is healed.
E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	And sometimes gather from all parts with a circle of cloth into the eye adjusted to great elevation, and immediately be perforated with a subtle spatula that comes to the prominence of the eye, and flow the humectant substance albuginea, and descend the eye and enter soon.
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	And immediately strengthen until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Twenty-Second Chapter.
De curacio de alconati.	On the Cure of Alconati.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This illness, which is called Alconati, is nothing more than pus that is adjusted in the eye resembling water descending and it is not that.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	But the manner of working on it is that you make the patient sit on a prepared and straight seat, and immediately take their head in your hands from two parts, and make them look into the pus as if they were looking at something; and immediately make it dry and not descend, and be quiet the light, and the patient sees the causes just as they see.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not descend below, you will know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	But if it is not prepared for the descent of the pus with water as we have said, then immediately make the patient sit between your hands and take a subtle spatula and find it on the panniculus cerning a small piece, that is to say, the continuation of the conjunctiva with the tunic cornea in the crown (to the location you see), until the pus is forgotten.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Therefore when it is forgotten, then you distill into the eye water cooled in which you have mixed honey or water in which you have brewed fenugreek and honey.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And immediately cure with other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Twenty-Second Chapter (again).
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	On the Cure of the Water Descending from the Eye.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already said the species of water in the division and which is suitable for perforation as we are declaring, then use that according to its suitability.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Then you must make the patient sit between your hands on a cushion and tie their own eye tightly with a string.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	And immediately pause your left hand near the patient's left palpebra if the eye in which the water is flowing is the left eye; or with your right hand if it is the right eye.
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	And immediately with your right hand take an almond if the eye is left; or with your left hand if it is right.
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	And immediately pause the extremity of the almond near the crown by the thickness of the ray in the album of the eye from the smaller lacrimal part, and immediately squeeze the almond with virtue and rotate your hand with it.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And immediately penetrate into the album of the eye and sense that the almond has already reached the desired point because of the vision.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And it is necessary that the path of the almond to the prominence be the measure of the space which is from the pupil to the end of the darkness, and it is the crown of the eye; for you will see with that pupil through the vision of the eye by the clarity of the tunic cornea.
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	And immediately pause the almond in the place where the water is, and immediately attract it downwards once or twice more, and thus if the water descends soon, then look at the patient over which their vision is soon to be clouded, and the almond in its own eye.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And immediately pause for a little while; thus if the water has descended, then you will lay that other way before the almond is dropped.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And thus when it is dried and does not descend, then you will extract the almond with ease, and rotate it with your hand little by little, and immediately dissolve in the water a small amount of clear gemstone salt and wash the eye outward; and immediately pause outside the eye with a cotton or stopper or lanolin infused in rose oil and albumen of egg whites, and bind with water the patient's eye.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But we have those of our time who pause on that which is mixed with albumen of egg whites.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if they do not obey your almond at the instrument of the eye by its hardness - for it is some of those men whose eyes are very hard - then you must take the spatula which is called the "alberid" and this is its form:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And thus perforate with it that conjunction, and do not stop your hand in the hole, and it is only if you make a way for the almond to reach the subtle location.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And immediately insert the almond according to what we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And you must complete your work, be prepared for the patient's sleep, which is made to descend in a place of darkness, and it is forbidden from all movements.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And pause in the nature of that water so that its nature is aligned, and do not trouble their head to the right or left side at all.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And be the ligature according to its disposition within three days.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And immediately loosen that in the darkest and most obscure manner, and make them see some causes, and then return to the ligature within seven days.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And do not need to do that in the hour of curations or soon after the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	They had need that you should alienate this because the water flows more lightly by great and vehement regard.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if an apostema occurs, then you must loosen the eye within seven days and correct it with water that allays the apostema.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Then you must absolve the vision from that and pause on the face of the mouth for which the direction of the left eye is regulated for a few days, existing in the darkest.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And immediately be guided by that greatest degree and converted into its own causes.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And know that in some cases the disciple is not exempt from seeing some things, and immediately you will be bold on the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And it has been reached to us of some of those who are at the Artach, and some said that a fire is made in the Ayrac, great and perforated, whereupon the water is drained.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	But meanwhile I do not see anything like it in our land which has been perfected, nor is it written in any of the books of the ancients; and it is possible that this is new.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are the forms of the species of magnesia for which there is something above those which are ignorant of those:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they are made of iron or of copper properly, and they are the extremities of theirs with this subtlety triangular, the pointed end just as that is the form.
Capitol .xxiv.	Twenty-Fourth Chapter.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	On the Cure of Carnousness in the Nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When in the nose there are born various fleshy growths adjusted of which some cause is assembled to scorpion's claw or polyp's foot; and this illness is called Polypus because it is like that of a fish represented.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And from it there comes cancerous flesh, blackened and dark in color; and from it there comes lion-like flesh not of dark color.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore in that which is in these lion-like flesh not fraudulent nor cancerous, it is necessary to make the patient sit between your hands and place them in the sun, and anoint the nose with oil, and pierce the tongue once in those flesh.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And immediately extract that from the parts outside, and immediately incise there what you have comprehended of those with a subtle spatula from one part into which you know that all the flesh is removed; for if any cause remains from it which abscission is possible, then you must ratify that with one of the subtle instruments with ease until no cause remains from it.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if you notice blood or an apostema occurs, then immediately pause on that which is necessary; for it is one of the malignant apostemas, then you must cut and cauterize that until the blood is absorbed and all the cavities are removed.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And immediately be guided in the nose with the incision, whether it be with water or oil.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and there is humidity proceeding into the palate, then you will know that it is already healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the humidity does not penetrate as it should, then you will know that behind it is carnousness in the pustules or bones of the nose to which no abscission has been achieved.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore it is necessary that you insert the thread of faith into one who has some thickness, and nourish him in his very marrow, and pause between each nourishment the quantity of said or less, and enervate the illness and insert one extremity of the thread in the nose with the ray or another cause which is possible to it.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And since this will have been done, then draw their odorment into the channels of the nose, and be exhausted above their goiter, for many times they seem like children in schools, and it is a light cause to that which they wish to do.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And immediately pause the two extremities of the thread, one extremity that comes out on the nose and the other that remains in the nose, and immediately administer a serration of flesh to the knots that are in the thread, and do this until you know that the flesh is already united with the knots of the thread.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And immediately extract the thread, and pause in the nose about the abstraction of blood one quart, and do this for three days or more until the flesh is completely consumed that remains of the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And immediately in the end of the cause, pause in the nose a lead cannula for several days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you degenerate from cure that exists, use this one.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument, the capillary purge maker, with which oils and medicines are distilled in the nose:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And make this of silver or copper, which is like a small open lamp, just as a small shell, and the mouth similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you wish, make a closed cannula like a reed, and the cannula of the instrument for capillary purging should be flat, open; to which there is a handle at the end, with which you can grasp that when it is filled with oil or water that you want from the juices and suitable causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these capillary purgings are precious: recipe of Castoreum from beavers, White Balm, Gingerbread, Yellow Pith of Safron, Long Pepper, Escarole, and Spica Ana Unc. and with a mixture of Suc of Bleeding and Caul, and make pills, and one pill be tempered with Tebesan water, and be guided into the nose of the patient who is suffering.
Capitol .xxv.	Twenty-Fifth Chapter.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	On the Holes in the Extremities of the Nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times it is born a hole in the extremities of the nose, and it is magnified and increased in several days until it is seen as the regard of it.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And therefore it is necessary that you incise that in the beginning of its appearance, and eradicate all that.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And immediately pause on the spot or cauterize or medicine which is competent for that place.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if it is delayed in its incision until it is magnified, then consider whether it is hardened, blackened, and lacks feeling; then do not touch that with iron because it is a cancerous apostema; for many times those who incise this apostema are driven by great malice towards him whom it had previously.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the apostema is of lion-like touch and not of dark color, and times that incision is possible in all that, then evacuate the patient and incise that without fear, and cure the place with what exists and constrain it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Twenty-Sixth Chapter.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	On the Suture of the Nose and Lips and Earlobe when continuity is dissolved by wound or appearance.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when there occurs dissolution of continuity in one of these cartilages, few confer on that operation except in some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when you are driven by some cause of those, know that if it is a fresh wound with its own blood, then immediately adjust the two lips of the wound with suture, and immediately cure that until it is healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of dissolution of continuity are already separated, and each is made whole, then it is necessary that you excise each part of its apparent cord until blood comes out.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And immediately adjust the two lips with suture and strengthen those, and on top of those powder with dragon's blood and threefold thrice, and pause on the powder a plaster of diaphonic emplastrum, or of some other consolidative emplastrum, and let that be bound for two days or three, and immediately release that and replace it with another plaster, and let that be until the threads are absorbed, and immediately cure with anointing until it is healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the method of suture is that you add the solution of continuity with threads, just as we have recounted in the suture of the belly, or add the solution of continuity with thread, just as I and thou wouldst make it known.
Capitol .xxvii.	Twenty-Seventh Chapter.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	On the Extraction of those causes that come into the two lips in the parts behind.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times it happens to many men in the parts behind their lips that some hard and rough apostemas appear, resembling errors, and some are smaller and some are greater.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, it is necessary that you convert the lips and fissures of each of those hardenings throughout all parts, and immediately fill the wound with sagitarius triticum until the blood is restrained, and immediately be washed with hot oil and be cured the place with what exists, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Twenty-Eighth Chapter.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	On the Incision of the flesh adapted to the Gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Great many times there is a swelling over the gummed flesh which the ancients called "albulus", therefore it is necessary that you suspend that with once or what you have with the forfices and incise that as it should be, and let the pus flow or the blood.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And immediately pause on the place with sagitarius triticum or other powders that are stimulating or exciting.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then immediately incise it secondarily, and cauterize it, for the cauterization will not return again.
Capitol .xxix.	Twenty-Ninth Chapter.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	On the Reason of Teeth with Iron.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When in the surface of the teeth of the parts behind and those of the forehead, and between the gums are adjusted rough, sharp, and blackened ones, some times they are blackened and are made citrines or greenish until the gum is corrupted and the teeth become loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And therefore it is necessary that you make the patient sit between your hands and pause the head in your seat, and ratify the teeth in which those roughs and causes appear like sand until there remains no cause from them, and this makes of the blackness and citrinity and of the others until they are purified.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Therefore, if this is what is in the beginning of the reason, well it is; and otherwise, then you must iterate the reason over those for another day and secondly and thirdly until it comes to the final statement as you wish.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth have need of many remedies of diverse forms and figures according to how it is prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And therefore since the remedies for the tooth that is extracted from behind are different from those used between teeth according to other forms, and these forms of remedies must be prepared by you which you will see soon:
Capitol .xxx.	Thirtieth Chapter.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	On the Extraction of Teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	It is necessary that you cure the tooth of its pain with all diligence and patience throughout its entire extraction, for there is no cause that supplies the vigor of it when it is extracted, since it is a subtle substance within which there is an excuse in the extraction of it.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But it is necessary when the patient is prepared to extract that tooth, that you be firmly certain which tooth is ailing, for many times the pain deceives the patient and makes him think it is in a healthy tooth, and you extract that one and immediately the pain does not cease until the sick and aching tooth is extracted, as we have already seen by the operation of the barber's.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, since you must be certain which tooth is ailing, and you know well, it is necessary that you scarify in the circuit of the tooth with spatula in the part where there is some virtue, until the tooth is dissolved from the gum of all parts, and immediately proceed to cauterize that with your own fingers or with fine forceps, little by little, until it becomes concave.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And immediately afterwards, hold the tooth firmly with great tenacity for good articulation or strong extraction, and pause the head of the patient between your fingers that well keep it so as not to trouble him, and immediately remove the tooth according to rectitude in manner so as not to break it, nor give greater pain to the patient.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And therefore if it is not forgotten, then immediately take one of those instruments and place it at a distance from the tooth on all sides with ease and effort to remove it in this way as it was done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is bruised or corroded, then it is necessary that you wrap with cloth the bruise and strengthen it at the end of a subtle ray in order that it may not be broken in the hour of your constriction upon it while you are holding it.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And it is necessary that you work exactly with scarification in the circuit of all parts of the gum and guard your strength so as not to break it and remain parted from him, and return to the patient for the malice that is greater than the first pain.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And beware that you do not do what some ignorant barbers do in their foolishness and audacity on the extraction of theirs, without administering what we have recommended; for many times they bring upon men great maladies which are more difficult to be broken, and their remedies rendered useless, or some of those, or that you extract it with some bones of the mandible just as many times we have testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And immediately after the extraction is done, wash the mouth with hot water or warm oil and salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if there is bleeding afterwards, just as many times it has happened, then immediately apply some quantity of egg white and sprinkle it over the wound, and if that egg white does not congeal, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and fine handles with which the tooth is mauled at the beginning should be of long extremity, short manubrium, and thick, in order that they may not bend when you are working with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And be like times of thick manubrium so that when you strain with those forceps they will not bend, with short extremities.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And be made of Indian iron with descending shapes like those of the right extremities, and in the extremities of those forceps be teeth that fit into each other and strain by strong constriction, and sometimes those extremities are shaped like the beak of a crane called ciconia, so it is guarded, and are of strong constriction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Thirty-First Chapter.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the Extraction of Teeth and Removal of Bones from Mandibles Gnawed.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you must extract a tooth which is gnawed by some cause, then it is necessary that you pause over the place with a border for one day or two until the place is mollified; and immediately thereafter apply gentle or hold the extremities of those which are assembled to the beak of a crane called ciconia or guard, the form of the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	Their extremities are made behind like lime or alfarfa.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if it does not obey to your touch with these forceps or handles, then it is necessary that you dig around the root and uncover all the flesh and insert the instrument which has no name, but is a small lever whose shape is this:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And it should be of short extremity, thick and small, and not bent in such a way that it will not gnaw.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore, if the root is forgotten, well it is; and otherwise, help yourself with these other instruments whose shapes are as follows: the shape of the first instrument is a triangular extremity in which there is some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it should be triangular and have a more subtle extremity.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And already you help yourself with this instrument having two ramps, the shape of which is as follows:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which precede in the extraction of teeth; for immediately it is made with this instrument which is assembled like a great once, and this is the shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of a twisted or short triangular extremity with some thickness, and not bent in such a way that it will not gnaw.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And know that many of the instruments for teeth are similar to each other and resemble the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the artisans skilled and subtle in their art, find for themselves according to what each operation and diverse diseases mean; for they are of diseases to which the ancients did not give nor pause a proper instrument, due to the forms of various species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the bone of the mandible or of the other bones of the mouth is gnawed, or if it is puffed up, then immediately be very careful about that in its place where it is convenient for the instruments and forceps which we have mentioned in the extraction of the roots of teeth, and help yourself with gestures like this:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And it should be in the place some thickness, little by little, and be wrapped or held in the mouth so that it does not escape or flee until the bone of all is forgotten; and immediately restore the place with medicines suitable for this.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a small puffiness in the bone, then immediately remove that from that puffiness and darkness, and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Thirty-Second Chapter.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	On the Cure of Teeth Elevated above Others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When the teeth are elevated and do not follow their natural form by those, and most especially when they appear in women, and most especially in venerable old ladies; therefore it is necessary that you consider: if a tooth is nothing like another tooth, and it is not possible to suture or bind them together, then immediately extract that one; but if it is annexed to another tooth, then you must incise it with this instrument whose shape is as follows; and it resembles a pig's mouth, and is made of Indian iron with an extremely sharp extremity.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And be your incision in which you incise it for many days due to the hardness of the tooth, and that it is not confounded with another tooth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the elevated tooth is exposed to wear and tear, then immediately grind it with a file of Indian iron whose shape is as follows:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And be all of Indian iron and the edge slightly worn; and be of many small points like a file with which are made needles, with which the tooth is ground gradually over many days with ease, in order that it may not be confounded with another tooth and decay.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And immediately finish grinding it to the end, and remove it with some rasors.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it is a tooth of which one part is gnawed and the tongue lies against it, then it is necessary that you grind it down until the sharpness of that fracture is removed and made smooth, and be filled so that the tongue does not lie against it nor corrupt the word.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Thirty-Third Chapter.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On the Restoration of Damaged Teeth with Gold or Silver Filling.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When accidents occur to the teeth in front of concussion and removal through percussion or falling, and the patient cannot strengthen over what is gnawed, and you have treated it with medicinal potions, and your treatment has not been effective, then immediately for this reason, so that they do not decay, make a filling of gold and not silver, because silver becomes green and immediately puffs up within some days, but gold is never changed.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the filling should be in such subtlety and thickness according to the quantity that can enter between the teeth; and the form of the remedy is that you take the filling and double it inside two healthy teeth, and immediately increase the two curvatures of the filling between two damaged ones, or one or many, until the filling reaches the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And immediately iterate the filling until you reach the part where you began, and strengthen your hand with ease and wisdom so that it is not damaged.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And be your constriction in which you bind the filling to the roots of the teeth so that they do not escape.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And immediately incise the superfluous extremities of the filling with forceps or toothed instruments, and add them to each place by gesture, and convert them and hide them between the healthy tooth and the damaged tooth, so that it does not cause injury to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And immediately release it as straight as possible.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is broken or crumbled, strengthen that one or those with another filling in such a way for all its time.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the restoration of two healthy teeth and two damaged ones, tied together as these are bound.
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when one tooth or two returns to its place and settles in its own location, and they are restored as we have recommended, and remain.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And only good craftsmen and wise ones can do this.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes it is suitable for some cause of cow's bones, and it is made from them as a form of teeth, and it is placed in the location where the tooth falls, and it is strengthened as we have said, and remains and serves that purpose for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Thirty-Fourth Chapter.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	On the Incision of the Ligament Which Appears in the Tongue and Prohibits Speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which appears behind the tongue sometimes or is natural to it, or accidental and occurs by wound that has already consolidated.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation is to open the mouth of the patient, and raise his tongue, and immediately incise that ligament nerve according to its latitude until the tongue is freed from its recent constriction.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if in that place there is some hardness or denudation, and it is fixed by the consolidation of the wound, then you must take care to cut and divide it according to its latitude until you have severed the ligament and dissolved the knot.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And beware that there is not a fissure made in the skin of the flesh, lest you cut and divide here, causing an artery to bleed.
