E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the aposteme is of the species of nodes or scrophulas, then you should divide it as we have said in the section on scrophulas, equally.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	And if the wound is extended in such a way that it would be painful to burn, then you should administer in it a cautery according to what we have previously said.
Capitol .xlix.	Forty-ninth Chapter.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of the section of apostemes that occur by artery or by vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is broken and the cord which is over it is consolidated, many times a post-hemorrhagic aposteme occurs. The signs by which it is known that inflammation and aposteme are due to an artery or vein: for when the apostema is due to an artery, it becomes long and swollen in the breast of the chest; and when you compress the apostema with those very words, you will feel a stridor.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is due to a vein is rounded on the surface of the chest.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And the section on this apostema is an error, and more so in those who are left with abscesses, and in the armpits, and in the neck, and in many places of the chest; and it is very great, therefore its cure by iron should be avoided, and that which is in the extremities or at the head should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But on that which is due to them by inflammation of the orifice of the artery, you should divide the section in the cord along its length; and accordingly, you should cut through the section with scissors and approach the artery, and deliver the tunics until it is uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And accordingly, you should tie that thread and make it pass through the other side, and tighten the artery with a double suture in two places, — which causes you to see ahead in extracting two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And accordingly, you should push the location which is between two ligaments with a spatula until all the blood that is in it is released and the aposteme is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly, you should administer the cure in which fire is generated until the ligaments fall off; and accordingly, you should cure that one with suitable ointments for that until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if the aposteme is due to section of a vein, then you should take hold of it with your hand and water as much as possible from the aposteme with the cord, and accordingly, insert the needle left of the location which you have held with your hand, and make it penetrate; and be in that file double so that you can extract that one from the other side, and accordingly, tie the aposteme with a good ligature according to what we have said about tying two parts together with two extremities of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread will be extracted, then accordingly, insert the needle with that thread left of all the aposteme and make the first incision with the needle, and tighten the threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	And accordingly, cut the aposteme in the middle of it until when that which is in it is released, then you should incise the excess cord, and leave what is tied to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly, pause over the powder which you have mixed with vinegar and oil, and accordingly, administer the cure which is made with some and ointments until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	First Chapter on the Aposteme that occurs due to Torsion of Nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as an aposteme occurs in the artery and vein, so also an aposteme occurs in the nerves when it is caused by percussion or excessive labor, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is made the most in the places of the assistants or anklebone, or in any place where the joints are disturbed.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a great aposteme, and it resembles the color of another body, and it is in the major parts of the body disposed to their own kind, when it is tightened with vehemence, and one feels in oneself like a stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an aposteme that grows in the breast of the body, and therefore it remains without cord, and it is hurtful to all parts and does not go to any parts before or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, of those that are in the joints, it is not necessary to be treated with iron, because very little would lead to contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But that which is in the head or forehead should be treated with cord and spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small aposteme, then you should treat that one with poultices and abscesses.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is great, then you should suspend that one with stitches, and excise it, and accordingly, stop that flow; and adjust the wound with suture, and cure that one until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Fifty-first Chapter.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of the Section on the Aposteme that occurs due to Childbirth, which occurs in the abdomen.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Hereafter I shall describe to some men many times in the bellies of those and in other parts of the bodies of those which are called fungals by similarity with those like fungi, whose roots are subtle and the head is thick; and already their lips are converted, and it is of those that are small, and it is of those that are very magnified.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I myself have seen one, and in the belly of it were two theils which were more like fungi, and there was no difference between them white, with fine roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already their lips were turned inward and split open, and moisture flowed from it all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, you should incise them and bury one in a pit that weighs 18 pounds. and the other weighed 6 pounds.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation in incising them is that you consider whether the patient is humid, and the color of the thiel is white, humid, with fine roots; then you should incise it with a spatula late, and be present while cauterizers are in the fire, because many times the section of it is expelled with much blood; and if you see the blood, cauterize that one.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if the patient is pale and tremulous, beware of incising with iron; but then take a lead thread freshly made, and tie it to that thiel, in the manner which we have said; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And accordingly, adjust it in the constriction of the lead thread; therefore, do not cease to strengthen the lead very much for that thiel, until it is abscessed and falls off by itself through excessive labor.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the thiel is of coarse roots, then in the incision of it there is some cause for fear and terror, and most especially in that which is in the abdomen.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But possible is that you incise most of it, and accordingly, cauterize that one so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And accordingly, cure that one until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And beware that you do not presume to incise a thiel which is of dark color, little sensation, and little regard, for that one is a cancerous tumor.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will remember an account of cancer accordingly.
Capitol .lii.	Fifty-second Chapter.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the Cure for Eminence of the Navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Eminence of the navel is caused by many reasons; either by fissures in the cicatrix which is on the abdomen, and eyes of it are torn or burst forth according to what develops in other ruptures; or by blood which flows from a vein or artery, as was said before, or by ventosity constricted in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is due to fissure of the cicatrix and bursting forth of the membrane, then the color of the aposteme is similar to the color of the body; and there is no pain, and accordingly, it appears in various situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is due to bursting forth of the membrane, then the situation of that one with water as we have recounted, but with a more violent diversity, and when you press that one with the threads said, it is hidden, and accordingly, it returns; and very little remains in it, and it is magnified much by the introduction of bath and violent labor.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is due to humidity, then there is no pain and it is not hidden when you press with your hand, nor is it constrained or creased.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to blood, then accordingly, the signs appear to decline towards blackness with that aposteme.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is due to flesh nothing, then accordingly, the aposteme is great, thick and hard, and it grows in a certain quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is due to ventosity, then accordingly, the touch of it is gentle.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation in it is that you consider whether the eminence of the navel is due to blood from an artery, or a vein, or ventosity; then you should be prohibited from curing it, because there is fear and terror alike as I have taught you in the chapter where I said about apostemes by artery and vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the eminence of the navel is due to the membrane or the skin, then you should command the patient to hold his breath and be standing upright; and accordingly, make a sign in the circuit of all the navel, and accordingly, command him to stand forward between your hands above his belly button, and accordingly, encircle with a spatula late in the circuit of the navel over the location which you have marked with the sign; and accordingly, extend most of the aposteme to the upper parts with a thread great; and accordingly, tie it in the circuit with a strong thread or cord and the manner of tying decent.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And accordingly, cut the middle of the extended aposteme over the ligament and insert the said thread into that indicated and seek out the membrane; and if you have not found nor guarded by the ligament, then you should extract the remaining part and push the membrane to the lower parts outside the belly.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have cut the membrane, then accordingly, take that one with a thread; and incise the excess parts of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then accordingly, surround that one with much, and accordingly, return to your operation; and take two needles and put them in those two strong threads and insert two needles into the circuit which you have made around the aposteme in a cross-like manner, so that they penetrate; and accordingly, strengthen the aposteme in four parts above the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, stop the needles and leave the location until the stretched skin relaxes and falls off by itself; or incise that one when it is softened and can be peeled away, and accordingly, cure that one with water as needed, until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the eminence of the navel is due to flesh nothing in it or by humidity, then accordingly, you should conquer the aposteme as we have said and extract the blood or humidity which you find there, and accordingly, cure that one with water as needed and consolidate the location.
Capitol .liii.	Fifty-third Chapter.
De curacio de cranc.	Of the Cure for Cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said in the division, of what kind of cancer it is and how it is treated with medicines, and that it is a savior in its cure with iron because it is not ulcerated; and we have said that cancer is generated through carelessness and caution in its treatment.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes cancer is in a place where its eradication is possible, such as breast cancer or womb cancer and to their likeness of members allotted to remove all that, and most especially when it is beginning small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is ancient and great, you should not dare to touch it, because I have not seen anyone heal from it nor has anyone else seen another case, nor is there any precedent for reaching that.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation in that case is when it is allotted as we have said, which is to precede and leave the patient and purge with black bile some times, and accordingly, sign him, if there is a manifest repulsion.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And accordingly, prepare the patient with preparation in which it is located for the operation, and accordingly, prohibit the use of those threads which are needed for that; and accordingly, concave from all parts with a good cord excitation so that there remains no cause for the roots of it.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And accordingly, let the blood flow and do not abscess it slightly, and express the places, and wash away the gross blood with your hand or with an instrument which is at your disposal among the instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if there is great contrariety of blood incised from the vein or artery, then accordingly, cauterize that one until the flow of blood is ceased, and accordingly, cure that one with another cure until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Fifty-fourth Chapter.
De curacio de ydropici.	Of the Cure for Hydrocephalus.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recounted in the division, the species of hydrocephalus caused by water and the signs of each species, and the cure for it with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that one which is cured with iron is only the species of athleta alone, and it is not approached by iron to the species of tympanic or to the species of hypsarchus, for this is deadly.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have already medicated this species of hydrocephalus tympanic with medicines and not confirmed your medication, then accordingly, consider, for if the patient has already been weakened by it, or is suffering from another disease or hydrocephalus, just as if it is in the head or chest and similar to those, then beware that you do not medicate it with iron, for fear is over that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you find the patient to be of great virtue and with no other disease but hydrocephalus alone, and not a child or an old person, then accordingly, the manner of the operation is that you lift the patient between your hands, and minister to it accordingly by expressing the belly of it with your own hand, filling the water into the part left of the pentynal, and accordingly, take a spatula with spines according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	with two sharp parts long, with an acute extremity just like a spatula; but however, be in it some smallness gradually, by reason that in the operation with that one you do not pass into the membrane, and lead that one.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And accordingly, consider if the generation of hydrocephalus is from one of the membranes, because then you should at that section remove yourself from the navel by the quantity of three times to the parts left, on the right side of it above the pentynal.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of hydrocephalus is due to disease of the liver, then accordingly, your section will be on the left side of the navel by three times.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation of it is due to melancholy, then accordingly, your section will be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And it is not necessary that your section be above the ribcage on which the patient lies, in order that the excesses do not flow to that location freely.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And accordingly, perforate with the instrument all the cord, and accordingly, insert into that section, and lift your hand with the spatula between the cord and the siphon, and you excise that one; and if it is the quantity of a fingernail or thereabout.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And accordingly, perforate the cicatrix until the spatula reaches the location where you want to find it, and it is the location of water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And accordingly, extract that one and insert an instrument with which this is the form:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a silver cannula; it is made of silver or of iron or of lead lion, at which the lower part is a small hole, and on both sides of it there are three holes: two from one side and one from the other side; and the end of it is incised according to the manner of a feather, just as I have said:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And on the uppermost part of it is a shell, because when the instrument reaches the water, then that one will suddenly descend upon the instrument, so as to evacuate from the water in equal proportion, for if you evacuate more than what is needed at that hour, the patient may soon die by resolution of their animal spirit, or you may cause harm to them which is close to death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But evacuate from that one according to the quantity of the virtue of it and according to what signifies to you the dispositions of the patient's virtue, of the pulse of it, and of the goodness of it.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And accordingly, extract the instrument, and retain the water which causes it to be retained because then it is being held back by the cord which retains the hole that is on the cicatrix of which I have said to you that you should perforate that one according to this manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And accordingly, repeat the instrument at another day if the patient tolerates this, and extract a small quantity of water, and do so for some days on account of fear, and beware of error until there remains only a little water.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear for the patient and leave a great quantity of water, then accordingly, cure that one by burial in hot sand, and mix it with sour wine and let it stay at the sun's warmth for a long time; and cure that one with desiccative medicines until it is healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize on the stomach, and the gallbladder and liver accordingly, with the extraction of water, according to what I have recounted in this which comes before.
Capitol .lv.	Fifty-fifth Chapter.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Of the Cure for Children Whose Bladders Do Not Perforate.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes some of the children are born with the bladder of their mother's womb and the head of their mixture not perforated (or is a small hole or not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore it is necessary to cauterize with perforation of it as soon as it is born with a spatula very fine according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And accordingly, pause in the hole a small clamp of lead and tie it, and let it be for three days or for four times.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when they wish to urinate, it will be remade and harnessed; and accordingly, return that one.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not pause the lead, it is possible that the urine which goes over the place will not let it close.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But that one from which the hole is small should be treated with a lead clamp, as we have said, for many days until it is amplified.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But those in whom the hole is not in its place, are affected with this, which is because of these, that one who is born and grows is at the end of the head of the urethra, so that it cannot urinate to the lower parts, until it raises the urethra with its own hand to the upper parts; and it is not a generation, therefore the sperm cannot reach the mother's womb according to rectitude, and it is a bad illness indeed.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the manner of the operation in this is that the patient should be bent over their own back, and accordingly, extend the head of the urethra with your left hand with a violent extraction, and incise the head of the head of the urethra at the location of the perineum with a sharp spatula, just as one would incise with a feather, or if you remove some part, so that the middle of it will resemble the head of the urethra and the hole will fall into its middle place according to what is needed.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And beware that in your operation of blood flow, because many times this happens; and pause yourself at the location where you incise the blood, and cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Fifty-sixth Chapter.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of the Phimosis Which Occurs in the Prepuce at the Head of the Urethra and Corruption, Blackness, and Adherence of the Prepuce at the Head of the Urethra.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many times this phimosis occurs in the urethra and is an excessive growth of flesh.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And one of them is malignant, and the other is not.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	Not-malignant, requires that you suspend with a thin thread and excise it until all the flesh is removed; and accordingly, pause over that part submerged in Egyptian ointment; and accordingly, cure it with divine oil until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the phimosis is malignant, of bad color, then accordingly you must administer cauterization according to the incision of it and the ratio of it.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if the phimosis is in the prepuce of the head of the urethra not circumcised, and one part of the phimosis is inside the prepuce and the other part is outside, then accordingly you must excise the phimosis which is inside first until it is consolidated; and then you will cure that outside, for when you cure it together with the prepuce, it is not certain that it will not be torn.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And already it happens in the genitals and in the prepuce blackness and corruption, therefore it is necessary that you cover all this which has already been denigrated and which already wants to corrupt or which has already corrupted; and accordingly, apply a liniment on top of it with honey, which has been mixed with the meal of scoria of millet and of errors trampled and crushed.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And accordingly, cure that one with another cure until it is healthy.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if there is excessive bleeding, then accordingly administer lunar cauterization according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	because the cauterizing juice is at two dispositions together, that is, to bleeding and to the wound when it is corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the urethra is corroded and destroyed entirely at once, then accordingly it is necessary that you insert into the meat of the prepuce a lead cannula so that the patient may urinate through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the prepuce with the head of the urethra (and this adhesion does not occur except in one whose prepuce is sound and no circumcision has been performed; and when adhesion occurs due to wound or abscess) it is necessary that you excise with a blunt spatula until the bond is dissolved and the head of the urethra is freed from all parts.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to excise those things exactly, then accordingly you must excise with a spatula some cause of the head of the urethra and the prepuce, and thus is why the prepuce, when it is subtle, is perforated by its subtlety little by little.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And accordingly, separate between the prepuce and the head of the urethra with a thread so fine that it is already moistened in water so that they do not adhere again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And accordingly, be cured with a gentle remedy until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Fifty-seventh Chapter.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the Circumcision of Children and the Cure for that Which Occurs in Them Due to Circumcision.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution of continuity like other wounds: but rather, since it is our operation and our will, and its purpose is properly in children, it is necessary that we assign to it the better operation and way of least harm, losing sight of health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore I say that the ancients did not prescribe circumcision in any of their free works, for they did not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired through experience, which is why you have found that most of the artists and barbers use to circumcise and cleanse with novacula and torores; and they use a thread with a needle and incision with the fingernail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already forbidden all these ways and did not find better cleansing with forceps, with thread and needle that in cleansing like the fingernail, because many times you have found the cord above, because the cord of the prepuce has two tunics, and remains the tonic more loose, and soon it is forced to another incision and certain pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And in the cleansing that is made by aphthas, and is digressive, of which the bakers use, it is not secure to make an incision at the extremity of the male member, because soon it will enter into the groove of it.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the operation with a fingernail, soon iron will obstruct and corrupt your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the cord of the child is short by nature, and many times it is in such a way that there is no need for cleansing, and I have seen this.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But the cleansing that is done with forceps and threads with a needle, the goodness, experimentally discovered by me, because the forceps are of proportional incision, therefore the sharpness above is like the sharpness below; and thus when you press your hand in proportion to two sharpnesses, and incise accordingly according to a comparison at one time; and it is made compression of the needle with a figure containing the cord of the urethra from all parts, with which there is no error whatsoever.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the manner of the first operation is that you should cause the child to be in a state of slight numbness, if it understands a little bit, so that you do not make more than just guide the needle into its urethra as much as possible, and let it stay there until the next day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And accordingly, make that child happy in all that manner which is possible to you as much as it receives its intelligence.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And accordingly, make that child stay between your hands very well prepared and not at all frightened; and conceal the forceps in your hand or let them lie on your foot, so that the child does not see those nor anyone else of the instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And accordingly, insert your hand into the urethra and blow on the cord, and pull that one until it reaches the head of the urethra, and accordingly, cleanse that which is attached to it in a sordid manner.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And accordingly, tie the marked place with a double thread, and accordingly, bind a small piece below it with another thread, and accordingly, hold it with the said pous and indicate the location of the thread left behind with good retention, and incise between two threads.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly, lift the cord little by little and extract the head of the urethra; and accordingly, let the blood flow slowly, because it is better; and pause powder above and on top of the powder, and put a cloth over it in which there is spread a mixture of honey mixed with rose oil that has been recently cooked in water and olive oil; and leave it on it until the next day; and cure it with a remedy until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The shape of the forceps for cleansing, this is the shape:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Should be the outer tips not cutting and the other ones cutting, so that there is no stick of the key, and should be the length of both edges as much as the length of two handles evenly.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the error in cleansing is that soon you will escape the entire intrinsic cord or a part of it through incision.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore, you should stretch that one with your hour and your fingernail in front of the wound's apostema at the location, and incise it according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your fingernail, then accordingly extract it with a thread and incise it.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	But if three days have passed and the apostema remains behind the urethra, then accordingly you should leave it until the apostema is cauterized, and excise that one with facility, and incise it according to what is prepared for you.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And beware of the head of the urethra, for it will not tolerate this.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And therefore, cure that one with the water which consolidates the wound with the powders which we have recommended in the treatise on powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is incised with the cord according to measure, and obeys the parts above, this will not hurt at all.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And therefore, cure that one with the water which we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Fifty-eighth Chapter.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the Cure for Retained Urine in the Bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is caused by oppression made through fear or pain or congealed blood, or through pressure or fleshiness, and similar to those we have said of the manners of cure in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved and you see retention of it to be due to fear which is already in the neck of the bladder, then accordingly the patient should be encouraged over their own fears.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And accordingly, lay the patient's weight on their own back and stretch their belly from the part above their back, and the patient should strain their arm as much as is possible.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, accordingly the neck of the bladder is constructed for the expulsion of fear from the parts behind, so that the urine is absorbed.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved with what we have said, and the cause of it is violent on the patient, then accordingly you must administer extraction from him with an instrument which is called syringe, of which this is the form: It should be made of silver and should be a subtle lion's claw, like a goose quill with subtlety of length in similarity to a palm and half, with a fine thread at its tip.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of extracting urine with that is to take a double thread and insert it into the extremity of the lana or cotone for good binding; and then you will put the extremities of the thread into the part behind the ciringua, and incise with forceps if there is any superfluous cause in the thread, but introduce it into the canula with vehemence And accordingly, put the ciringua in order with border and album of honey.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And thus let the patient sit on a stool, and envelop the bladder of him with oil of olive, and water and aqua.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And accordingly, introduce the ciringua with facility into the root of the urethra; and accordingly, double the urethra above at the part of the abdomen; and accordingly, push the ciringua into that one, and accordingly, push it until it reaches the bladder, and so the patient will be brought to the cause, and not made in this way according to this order, but rather the meat in which goes to twisting.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And accordingly, stretch the thread with the linen little by little, because the urine will saturate the linen.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	And accordingly, extract that and make it for urine cure, and use the ciringua, do not cease to do so and use the ciringua until the bladder is evacuated and the patient attains relief.
Capitol .lix.	Nineteenth Chapter.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the Quality of Cathartics for the Bladder with Clamp-cedra and similar instruments which are in accordance with this.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When ulceration or apostema occurs in the bladder, or congealed blood is present there, or it is narrowed by pressure, and you want to distill waters and medicines into it, then accordingly it should be made with an instrument which is called clampcedra, and this is its form:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	but in the extremity of it, it is soundless, that is to say, it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in that one are three holes: two on one side, just as often times.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	In the beginning it is a concave place, in which water is poured, and it should be according to the quantity that fills it, without addition, until when some cause is drawn from it with the humidities, it should be drawn out, and when it is expelled, with water it should be drawn out, and when it is long, as the clampcedra does, which is filled with naptha in naval battles.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, when you want to procure humidities in the bladder, introduce the extremity of the clampcedra into the humidity, and draw out with it the water that is poured above, because the humidity is drawn out into the concavity of the clampcedra.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And accordingly, introduce the extremity of the clampcedra into the urethra, according to what we have recommended in the ciringua; and accordingly, pour in the humidity with water, because that humidity comes to the bladder soon, and the patient will be relieved.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Form of the Subtle Catheter by which the Bladder is Catheterized, and this is its form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it should be made of silver or lead, the head of which is similar to a small feather, and behind it there is a thread-like ligament.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And accordingly, take the bladder of motion, and put in it the humidity that you want to catheterize in the bladder, and accordingly, tie it between two with a strong ligature made of double thread, and heat up that humidity over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And accordingly, insert the extremity of the catheter into the urethra.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And accordingly, press your hand on the bladder with the humidity and stretch down into it until the patient feels that that humidity has already reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not have a bladder present, then accordingly take a bag of parchment and make from it a circle; and perforate that one all around its circumference; and accordingly, insert a strong thread into those holes, just as they are revolved; and accordingly, add the circle just as it is added also, so that you pour into that which you want of the humidities, oils and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And accordingly, tie that one to the instrument and do with it just as you have done with the bladder, and express with your hand until the humidity reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Sixtieth Chapter.
De extraccio de peyra.	Of the Extraction of Fear.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division the species of fear and its cure with medicines, and the difference between fear generated in the lungs and fear generated in the bladder, and its signs.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said the fear in which cutting operation is made with hand, and section.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the fear generated in the bladder properly is that which is placed in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And you narrate it with clear exposition and abbreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore I say that the fear generated in the bladder is mostly seen in children; and its signs are that the urine that comes out of the bladder is similar to water in its subtlety, and appears in it like sand; and the patient feels their urethra, and often times they cry out, and accordingly is dressed; and with this, you see for yourself how these things come about.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is laughable to see the healing of children from that until they have reached 14 years old; and it is difficult to cure in the elderly.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young ones, it is milder because it is among them.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that from which fear is greater and cure is easier; And if it is little, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, when we come to the cure of that, it is necessary at the beginning of that one to cleanse the patient with a catheter which extracts all the fissure that is in their gutters; for that fissure sometimes prevents the entry of fear into the bladder.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And accordingly, the patient should be pressed with their own weight and be compressed and tightened in such a way that fear descends to the bottom of the bladder, or else it jumps from one place to another.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And accordingly, make that one sit between your most prepared hands, and the most of it are left in its things, so that the bladder is made to decline into the parts behind.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And accordingly, take care of that one and all that is outside.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel fear in the space, then accordingly you should sit down immediately with section upon it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if it is not entirely gone, then accordingly you should take some oil and anoint your left hand with it, if the patient is a child, or a little oil if they are a full-grown young person, and insert that into their anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And take care of the fear until it stays behind your said indication.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And accordingly, convert that one little by little into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And accordingly, press upon that one with your said indication, and push it out into the parts outside the place from which you took section.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the assistant to press on the bladder with their right hand; and command another assistant to extend the legs above into the parts with their left hand, and with their other hand to relax the cord which is behind the legs, in the part where the section is being made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And accordingly, insert the spatulum, as follows is its form:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and cut in it as far as the distance between the anus and the legs, not in the middle location, but before the left side of the cleft; and make the section on that fear and your said indication be in the anus, and make it a transverse section, so that the section outside is wide and behind tight according to the quantity that you have extracted from the fear as possible, and not greater, because then the pressure would compress your said indication which is in the anus, and it would be forgotten with difficulty.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that from the fear is some which has an angle and corners, for which the extraction of it is made difficult by this.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And from that one, there is a part resembling a grain of flint, which is rounded and made for easier extraction.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore, if it is that one with angles and corners, adjust it in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not like that, then accordingly you should gently press upon it, or that you stretch upon it with decent gestures, the extremity of which should be as a file with which you stretch upon fear, and do not remove from it; or that you insert behind it a subtle instrument with curved extremity.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot upon it, then accordingly you should enlarge the hole a little, and if you see a flow of blood, cut off in strength with vitriol thrice strained.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the fear is more than one, then accordingly at first you should guide your hand to the mouth of the bladder, and accordingly insert upon it; and accordingly guide a little further ahead; and similarly do so if there are many more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the fear is very great, then accordingly ignorance is that you insert that one with great section, for it happens to the patient either death or confusion of the continued distillation of urine, so that the place is not entirely consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But manage expulsion from it until it is forgotten, or generate in the fracture of it with forceps until it comes out in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore, when you have completed your operation, then accordingly fill the wound with the sap of aloe and the blood of dragon, and strengthen that one.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And pause over that cloth dipped in oil and vinegar, or in rosy oil and water, so that the suppuration may be checked.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And accordingly, repose the patient on their back, and do not release the bandage for three days.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when you have released that one, bathe the wound with water and some oil, and accordingly cure it with dayphonic ointment and diabolic ointment until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound an apostema occurs, which is cautious and corroding, and from it seems as if the blood is congealed in the bladder with urine, and by that the urine is prohibited (and this is known through the efflux of blood with urine), then accordingly insert your said indication into the wound and extract that blood, for if it remains, it will provoke the bladder to corruption and putrefaction.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly, wash the wound with vinegar, water and salt, and with opposition to all species, with that which is needed for the cure until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And take care in all hours of the entire cure that you look after both the wounds and adjust the medicines which are paused over the place.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the fear is small and is in the meat of the urethra, and it is stuck in there, and urination is prohibited, then accordingly cure that one with what you previously recommended before reaching section, for many times this cure will be accused of section; and now I have tried this, and it is that you take a perforator made of iron alfelut, the form of which is as follows:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	with a triangular extremity, sharp, stuck into a stick.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And accordingly, take a thread and tie it to the urethra behind the fear, so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And accordingly, insert the iron into the urethra, perforating with ease until the perforator reaches that fear.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And accordingly, rotate the perforator with your hand in that fear little by little, and you perforate the perforation of it until you make it pass to the other side penetrate; for then the urine is soon absorbed.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And accordingly, press your hand upon that which remains of the fear from the part outside of the urethra, for that is twisted, and forgotten with urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this cure is not suitable for you due to some cause which prohibits it from that, then accordingly tie a thread below the fear, and another thread above the fear.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And accordingly, encircle the fear in that urethra between two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And accordingly, extract that one.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And accordingly, release the ligature and purify the congealed blood which is formed in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to tie the thread below the fear, except to prevent it from returning to the bladder, and the other ligament above, for when the thread is released close to the extraction of the fear, the cord returns to its place and covers the wound.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And therefore it is necessary for you when you tie the thread above, that you raise the cord to the upper parts, or else you should return your said indication and cover the wound as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Sixtieth Chapter.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of the Extraction of Fear in Women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Fear in women is rarely generated.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if fear occurs in some of those, then accordingly the cure is difficult and prohibited by many manners.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that the woman very quickly becomes shamefaced.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you do not find a woman who knows how to describe if she has been deceived by her husband when he is chaste, or is one of those women who have husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you do not find a woman who knows this art, especially the operation with my hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the location of the section on fear in women is far from the location of the fear, so you need a deep section, and in it there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity provokes you to this, then accordingly it is necessary that you take a woman who is well known and not easily found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of that one, then accordingly look for another who is quiet and subtle, or present a mature woman well-versed in the nature of women, or a woman who has been trained in this art apart from the art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Therefore, present that one and command them to do everything you will tell them, from the inquisition of fear to the beginning; which cause is that they look if the woman is shamefaced, then accordingly it is necessary that they put their said indication into her anus and seek out the fear.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore, if you find that one, cut it off below your said indication, and then command them to insert upon it.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not shamefaced, then accordingly command the matron to insert her said indication into the privates of the patient and inquire about the fear, since she pauses her left hand over the bladder, and compress that one with good compression.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore, if you find that one, then accordingly it is necessary to gradually push her through the orifice of the bladder into the parts behind with the summit of her virtue until she reaches the root of the cleft.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And accordingly, insert upon that one the opposition of the greatest part of the privates, to the root of the cleft of some part being in a position and centring the fear in that part, and the said indication not being removed from the fear cut off below.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the section should be slight at first; and accordingly, insert a ray upon that section, and if you feel the fear, then adjust in section according to the quantity which you know that the fear will be extracted from that.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the species of fear are many: for some are slight and great, and lion-like and rough, and long and rounded, and have ridges.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore, you know how many species there are of it for this reason that you signify on that which you will.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see a flow of blood, adjust to the place with vitriol thrice strained and let it be for an hour until the blood is stopped, and then return to your operation until the fear is forgotten.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And make sure you prepare with you the instruments which are said in the extraction of fear in men, so that you may be helped by them in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see a flow of blood, and know that the expulsion of blood is from the instrument that is inserted, then accordingly you pause powder on the place and strengthen that with powders and strictures descending, and do not iterate this; and leave the fear and do not extract it, for very soon the patient will die.
