E aprop cura la plagua.	And accordingly, cure the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Therefore, when the acuity of blood is ceased after some days, and the place becomes quiet, then accordingly you return to your operation until the fear is forgotten.
Capitol lxii.	Sixty-second Chapter.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of Section on Hernia Accursed.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia accursed is nothing but an aggregation of moisture in the white membrane which is below the cord of the genitals containing the humor, and it is called ciphac.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And sometimes it is in the proper panniculus which nature has prepared in the part of the humor, so that it is covered with another humor; and it is the cord of the genitals between the white membrane which we have said, and it is not this but rather a kind of tart.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is due to weakness which occurs in the genitals, so that it pours out this material into them; and sometimes it occurs due to blows inflicted on the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this humidity has many colors, for its color is declining to citrine or sanguine, or red, or it is black feculent, or white watery, and it is this that is most.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is known where this aggregation of water is so: for if it is in the white membrane which we have said, then accordingly the apostema is rounded declining a little towards length thus resembling a figure of humor, and appears the genitals, for the humidity contains that in all part.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the moisture is in the proper panniculus, then accordingly the apostema is rounded with a part of humor and by that one estimates it to be another humor.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the moisture is between the cord of the genitals and the white membrane, then accordingly it is caught below the sentiment.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And when you want to know the cognition of the color of the moisture, then accordingly you examine the color of the moisture in the apostema with the surrounding area of which the form is preceded; and according to this that is situated in the vestige of the surrounding area, judge what it is deduced from.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore, when we come to the cure of it with iron, then accordingly it is necessary that we command the patient to be flayed and botomed if this is possible for you, and fill his body full.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And accordingly, be reposeful on your back on some cause a little above, and pause below with many cloths.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And accordingly, set yourself on the left side of him, and command the minister to follow on the right side of him, who should stretch his arm to one of two sides to the cord of the genitals and to the part of the miraculous wound in the belly.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And accordingly, take a spatula late and cut the cord of the genitals from the middle to the length, so that it is close to the navel.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And accordingly, make the section according to rectangular equality, at a distance from the line that you should follow along the skin of the genitals, until it reaches the white membrane comprehending.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And accordingly, scrape it away, and observe, and take care that you do not insert it; and your scraping with which you scrape it away by part below so that it is suspended in the humor most and subtly scrutinize the scraping according to the quantity possible for you.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And accordingly, pierce the white membrane full of water with a wide perforation, and extract all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And accordingly, separate between the two lips of the section with hooks, and extend the membrane to the upper parts; and do not touch the cord of the genitals comprehending, and insert the membrane in that manner which is possible for you.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And accordingly, insert that one with its totality or in pieces, and mostly your subtle parts, for if you do not scrutinize the insertion of it exquisitely, there is no certain guarantee that the water will not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the humor proceeds from that outside of its cord in the time of your operation, then accordingly when you have completed the section of the membrane, return to the inside of it, and accordingly adjust the two lips of the cord of the genitals with suturing, and accordingly cure that one as well as the other wounds, until it is healed.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find the humor corrupted by another disease, then accordingly it is necessary that you cut out the vessels which are sour to the suspender, and extract the humor, and accordingly cure that one with what we have said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	But if the water is aggregated in two separate parts, then you know that there are two hernias; therefore, insert that part according to what you have done in the other equally; and if it appears to be one operation, then you do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	And accordingly, you wash the blood, and immerse in the sections wool submerged in oil or red oil; and pause outside another wool which you have immersed in wine and oil, and spread that one over two genitals and the miraculous wound in the belly; and pause above folded cloths and powder, and tie those above with a knot according to this form:
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	and accordingly, there are pressed two cloths and they are filled with wool carded according to this likeness; and the extremities are made with those which are bound with cloth or wet wool, and they are added with stricture in the codpiece of the breeches, and one of the extremities takes from the cleft to the back, and the other takes at the part of the navel, and two extremities on two cresses below and two extremities above on two groins, and all the structure is adjusted in the codpiece of the breeches.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes this hernia is medicated artificially with caustic in place of section with iron; and it is that you take caustic cutlery subtle and insert it into the cord of the genitals, and ignite according to what we have recounted until the white membrane containing the water is revealed, and then you take caustic according to this form:
e es asemblat a letra greca.	and it is gathered in Greek letter.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	And accordingly, pierce into that membrane, and ignite until all the humidity is exhausted.
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	And accordingly, extend the membrane with hooks, and scrape with hooks, and scrape with caustic subtile ignited; and insert that one according to what is possible for you until it eradicates all of it; and take care not to let the water touch the fire.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And you know that this operation is more safe and more lengthy of blood flow, and better than the operation with section.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	But if you feel contrariety of apostema in the hour of section or in the hour of cauterization, or blood flow, then accordingly it is necessary that you cure which contrariety does to you by this means, with the care which corresponds to him according to what is said.
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa.	But if the patient is pale and does not hope for a second operation due to its horror, then accordingly administer perforation according to what we have said here; and it is when you are certified by this that you know, according to what we have said about the significations, that that hernia is watery.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	Then accordingly you should make the patient sit on some elevated platform, and accordingly pierce the apostema in the lowest part of him with a spatula late, and pause the perforation according to the length of the body.
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And make it wide so that all the water is drained out.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	And accordingly, pause on the location of the knot and tie it and leave it so that the remaining water flows out.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And accordingly, cure that one until the wound is healed.
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	But if there is contrariety to the egress of water in that hour, then you should pierce it: and this is not done unless by this reason, because the white panniculus at the orifice of the wound causes contrariety and prohibits the exit of water; accordingly, it is necessary that you put into the wound a probe or instrument with which the water is extracted from the drops, the form of which is preceded; or adjust in the position of the wound a small one.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And you know that the water returns, and is aggregated accordingly after about two months or so; and as it is aggregated, then it should be pierced according to that manner, because the patient will thus pass his days.
Capitol .lxiii.	Sixty-third Chapter.
De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Of Section on Carnous Hernia and its Cure.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	You know that in the section on this hernia there is fear of being lost through destruction in the major dispositions; for which my sight has seen the dismissal of it and being saved by that better one.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And you are well-remembered to operate in that and the species of apostemes.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	So I say that the apostemes are born in the bodies of those whose genitals are composed and it is made so by many causes: or by acute and severe superfluity, which is poured into the genitals, or by blows.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And it is the color of the aposteme according to the color of the body, and it is not found in him pain, and it is a grave aposteme.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	And very little is the aposteme calcified, of which the color is dark, and there is no sentiment to it.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	And sometimes it is made by concretion of the arteries, and by inflammation of those vessels so that already the recollection of it is perceived, or by inflammation of veins.
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	But that which is due to inflammation of arteries is known by the dispersion of the aposteme when you compress it with those said ties; and there is no need for it to touch.
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	But that which is due to inflammation of veins is not dispersed from it for any cause, even if compressed with the said ties.
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	And it is possible that on this species, a section be made and on the other fleshy parts; and it is that you insert the cord of the genitals, and accordingly extend the humor to the upper parts, and extract that from the white membrane, and deliver the suspensor of the vessels, and tie them, and insert the suspensor more than you deliver it from all part of the parts of the humor.
Donc si l’huou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	Therefore, if the humor is already consolidated with those fleshy parts, then accordingly it is necessary that you extract the humor and insert that.
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	And if there is adhesion due to some cause of the membrane or between what is between the vessels, then accordingly it is necessary that you deliver all that adhesion and insert that one by rounded insertion.
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	But if there is natural flesh behind the adhesion, then accordingly it is necessary that you insert all that which is of him, and extract the humor thus as we have said.
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when your operation is complete, then accordingly fill the wound with wool impregnated in red oil and wine; and accordingly cure that one with another care until it is healed.
Capitol .lxiv.	Sixty-fourth Chapter.
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	Of the Cure of Hernia which is of Vine.
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.	Vit is an aposteme wrapped in some wrapping resembling a shoot with softening of the testicles, and it is made difficult for the patient to move, exercise, and walk.
E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	And in the cure of this disease it is by fear due to that which is preceded by recollection.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	However, it is necessary that we say operation in that according to what I did with the first ones.
E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	And I say that it is necessary to make the patient sit on an elevated platform; and accordingly, pinch the suspensor of the testicles at the left side; and accordingly, take hold of the cord of the genitals with the said ties and vessels which are proved to be tender to the verge; and have another minister who you, and stretch those ones with great extension.
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	And accordingly, insert by spatula late and make a cross section in the right of the vessels so that the vessels are uncovered.
E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	And accordingly, scrape off all part as we have said in extraction of arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop fica en aquelas un’agulha en la qual sia fiel doble, e lia aquel en le primier del locs en les quals accideys vit, e lia aquel autra veguada en le derier de lor.	And accordingly, put an awl in those places where it is faithful double, and tie that one at the first of the locations where Vit occurs, and tie that other time at the last of them.
E aprop inscideys aquels en le mieg loc per seccio dreyta segon la longuesa del cos, e extratz aquo que es agreguat de las humiditatz fetulentas e corruptas.	And accordingly, insert those in the middle location by right section according to the length of the body, and extract that which is aggregated from the foul and corrupted humors.
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	And accordingly, cure the wound with the care of other wounds in which you wish to be born and generated by so that the vessels may not flow from one of two genitals, for it is not evil because of this.
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que·ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	But if Vit occurs in all the vessels, then accordingly it is necessary that either the testicles be extracted or that the testicles by this are blocked with the vessels, so that they may be deprived of all nourishment by the obstruction of the vessels, and be putrid, or that it happens because there is no further use with those.
Capitol .lxv.	Sixty-fifth Chapter.
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	Of the Cure of Intestinal Hernia.
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	The advent of this hernia is due to section that extends in the membrane stretched over the belly from the sides of the miraculous wound of the abdomen, so that the intestines being torn away fall into one of the intestines.
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	And this rupture is either of the membrane or of excess of fluid, and occurs in these two species due to many causes: or percussion, or by blow, or by shout, or by elevation of some grave cause, or by resemblance.
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	And the sign of this is when it occurs gradually over a long period of time, and does not occur suddenly, and it is an aposteme that grows within the ventral area, because the membrane compresses the intestine.
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	And the sign of it is when it occurs due to section of the membrane, because at first it causes sudden and vehement pain; and it is an aposteme that appears differently below the apparent cord given off, and this is due to effusion of the intestine, and the body of it in the parts outside the membrane.
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	And sometimes it is forgotten with the intestine's cloth, and this hernia is called intestinal hernia cirrhal.
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	And sometimes it is caused by ventosity, and sometimes it runs in the intestinal fissure, and here it is retained, and it is in this great perniciousness of the patient, and sometimes it causes evil pain and mostly when it is pressed.
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	And in the cure of this disease with iron, there is fear, because it is necessary to avoid the caustic in that one.
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	And the manner of the operation of that one is to command the patient to turn out the intestine with his own hand to the outer parts of his own conquest if he obeys his returnment, and accordingly it should be inserted over his own back between your own shoulders, and lift up the legs of him.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	And accordingly, straighten the cord which binds the cord of the testicles to the upper parts, and insert the cord of the testicles all along; and accordingly, put it in two lips of the section, according as you need to open the section with those.
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	And if the section is done according to the quantity that it is possible for you to forget about that one's humor.
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	And accordingly, scrape off that membrane which is below the cord of the testicles, until the white hard membrane is revealed from each part.
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	Then accordingly you put your said tie in that which secures the testicle, in that which is between the white membrane and the one that is below the cord of humor, and between the second membrane, and absolve with that adherence which is in the back part of the humor.
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	And accordingly, take hold of the cord of the testicles with your left hand and extend the white membrane on its side, and lift up the humor with the membrane to the part of the section; and command the minister to extend the humor upwards and you dissolve the adherence that is behind with complete solution.
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And search for those ties which make sure that there is no cause of the intestine enveloped in the white hard membrane.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you find any cause in it, then accordingly you will pinch that one below to the belly.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And accordingly, take a needle with a thick faith of ten faiths, and enter that which should be the last of the membrane, which is below the cord of the testicles, which is the section; and accordingly, insert the extremities which emerge from the faith until they are four faiths, and accordingly, compose some of them into a figure in the manner of a cross; and tie with that one the membrane of which we have said that it is below the cord of the testicles with strong bonding of two parts.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And accordingly, envelop the extremities of the faiths and tie them with strong bonding until some of the vessels that nourish those cannot transmit any cause by which from here an aposteme would not occur.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And pause another tie binding according to the first binding, distant from that one by three ties; and accordingly, leave those two bindings with the membrane which is below the cord of the testicles, in the quantity of the greatness of that said, and insert all the remaining part according to roundness, and stop the humor.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And accordingly, insert into the part below of the cord of the testicles by section of which blood and pus should flow as we have recounted in this place that we have said.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And accordingly, administer wool soaked in oil, and pause on the wound; and administer the binding which we have recounted (and sometimes the white membrane is cauterized, which we have said should be done with caution to prevent flux of blood, for many times those things occur) and let the binding settle until it falls by itself.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if the caustic of that one is delayed, then accordingly cold water should be applied, and pause over it until it falls as we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly, cure the wound with the other care of wounds until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvi.	Sixty-sixth Chapter.
De hernia ventosa.	Of Ventral Hernia.
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia, it is not seen that there has been any boldness in the cure of it with iron.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	And the first ones said that it is made as we have recounted in the hernia which is with vinegar; which is that you tie the vessels accordingly to the section on that one with facility of it; and accordingly, cut off in the middle place around the aposteme with water which works that, until the vessels fall.
E cura la plagua segon que havem dit entro que sia sanada.	And cure the wound as we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvii.	Sixty-seventh Chapter.
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	Of the Disruption which is made in the Angulations.
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Sometimes a rupture occurs in the angulations as we have said, and emerges from the place.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And there is no need for the genitals to have any cause of the intestines at the genitals; and if there is, it is rare; and returns in all hours.
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	But if the time is prolonged in this way, a fissure is adjusted in the membrane so that the intestine descends into the membrane; and this occurs because of the extension of the membrane which is in the angulations as we have said, which cause is because the membrane is stretched and the place becomes apostematized and emerges.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And the cure of it is with a caustic as was preceded by the narration of it.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And sometimes it is cured with iron according to this manner: and it is that the patient lies on his back between your own shoulders, and accordingly, cuts off the place of the rupture of the apostemes emerging by section through the width according to the quantity of three ties.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And accordingly, strengthen the white membrane that is below the cord until it is revealed.
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And accordingly, take a ray and pause it on the elevated place of the membrane, and press that one against the womb of the belly.
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And accordingly, close the two elevated places on the extremity of the ray of the membrane, and adjust them with a suture one to another.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And accordingly, extract the extremity of the ray, and do not insert it into the membrane completely, nor extend the humor, nor any other cause as you should know to be in the cure of intestinal hernia.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And accordingly, cure that one with the care of wounds, and as you insert the threads, purify it and restore the wound until it is consolidated; for the membrane is contracted and the prominence of rupture is not adjusted.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cauterization is better in this place, because it is more conducive to health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Sixty-eighth Chapter.
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Of the Softening of the Cord of the Testicles.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Many times the cord of the testicles in some men is softened because the flesh that is between it is softened, and it is feared the reckoning of it.
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Therefore it is necessary for that one who is treating the case to make the patient lie on his back, and insert all the cord which has been softened over the natural cord; and accordingly, adjust two lips with a suture.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you wish, cut off in the beginning the superfluity of the softened cord with three or four cauterizations and a firm suture.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	And accordingly, insert between the sutures; and accordingly, cure through the cure of other wounds until it is healed and the threads fall.
Capitol .lxix.	Sixty-ninth Chapter.
De castracio.	Of Castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Know that castration in our law is excommunicated, but by reason it has been granted to me to recall it in this book; and it is not necessary to recall it except for two manners, of which one is because of the science of the doctor when he is questioned about it, so that he may know the cure of it which occurs; and the other manner is that many times we have needed castration of other beasts for our uses through those animals, such as mares, oxen, and pigs, and similar to beasts.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is done in two manners: or by attrition, or by incision by section.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	But in that which is done by attrition, the way of the operation is that we make the beast lie in cold water until its genitals are softened and relaxed and hang.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And accordingly, take those with your own hand until they are resolved and do not appear to leave any touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in castration done by incision and section, it is necessary that you hold the beast and press the cord of the testicles with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And accordingly, tie the suspenders, and insert one section over each humor until two humors process.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And accordingly, insert those so that you will have whatever is excoriated.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not leave any cause on the membrane of the cord, but only the subtle membrane which is above the vessels.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this manner of castration is better which is done by attrition, because attrition gently leaves no cause of the testicles so that the beast desires to copulate.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And accordingly, cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	Seventieth Chapter.
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	Of the Cure of Hermaphrodism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphrodism in men is according to two manners: one is when a figure appears in that space which is between the cord of testicles, in which there are two testicles as if they were joined together like a woman's genitals.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And sometimes from that one flows urine which is in the cord of the testicles.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	But in women it is a species: and it is that the woman's clitoris above the pubes is like two male testicles, a little bit small, and at the top part, just as the male urethra and two testicles.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the cure is of three species: two of men and one of women's.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And it is that you must insert those adjusted flesh parts so that they flee from the pressure of that one, and accordingly, cure those with the cure of other wounds.
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And in the second species of men from which urine flows which is in the cord of the testicles, there is no cure or operation for it.
Capitol .xxi.	Twenty-first Chapter.
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	Of Lentigo and Eminent Flesh due to Causes of Women.
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	Lentigo is very slightly adjusted according to natural causes, so that it is stretched and made visible; and sometimes it is magnified in some women to such an extent that it spreads like in men and penetrates into the coitus.
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	Therefore, you must take the superfluity of lentigo with your own hand or with a needle and insert it.
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	And do not leave any residue in the insertion, especially in the region of the razor, so that it does not provoke a flow of blood.
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	And accordingly, cure that one with the cure of wounds until it is healed.
Mays carn nascuda es carn que nays en le horrifici de la mayre entro que umple aquel, e fort leu es eyssit a las partidas deforo segon semblansa de coa (e per aquo alscus primiers appelero aquo “malautia caudada”); donc cove que nos inscidam ayssi cum inscidem lentinge, e curem aquela entro que sia sanada.	But born flesh is flesh that grows in the horror of the great one until it fills that one, and very slightly emerges at the top parts as if from a hen (and for this reason we will also call this "disease of the tail"); therefore, you must insert it just like inserting lentigo, and cure that one until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxii.	Seventy-second Chapter.
De curacio de alratica.	Of the Cure of Eczema.
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	Eczema is when a woman's clitoris is not perforated or is only slightly pierced.
E es o natural o accidental.	And it is either natural or accidental.
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	Accidental is due to disease that has preceded, and it is caused either by flesh not well adjusted or by subtle membrane or thick skin.
E es fayt o en le preon de la mayre, o en les costatz de lu, o en le pus sobira de lu, o en le pus bas de lu, e prohibeys de cuoyt e de enprenguacio e de enfantament, e fort leu prohibeys las mestruas.	And it is caused either in the abdomen of the great one, or in the sides of it, or in the uppermost part of it, or in the lowest part of it, and prohibits copulation, pregnancy, and childbirth, and very slightly prohibits menstruation.
E la cognicio de aquela es fayta per reguardament de la metrona, si la oppilacio es apparent, propdana; mays si no es apparent, lahoras tu cerqua aquela am les tieus ditz o am le ray.	And the knowledge of that is made by observing the metrona, if the swelling is apparent, then pronounced; but if not apparent, then accordingly you should search for it with the ties or with the ray.
Mays si oppilacio es per ciphac subtil, e es propda a las doas labias, lahoras tu coyta e disromp aquela.	But if swelling is caused by subtle membrane, and it appears on both lips, then accordingly you should cut and break that one.
E es que pauses sobre las doas labias pulvils, e aprop pausa les tieus ditz indicz de amdoas las mas encemps.	And you pause over the two lips with powder, and accordingly pause the threads indicated on both sides.
E la femna sia sobre le sieu dos, las sieuas coyssas extendudas, e aprop exten las doas labias am forsa entro que aquel ciphac subtil sia romput e la oppilacio sia uberta.	And the woman should be on her back, her arms extended, and accordingly extend both lips with force until that subtle membrane is broken and the swelling is opened.
E aprop pren lana e enbeu le4 en oli e pausa aquela sobre·l loc, e jagua am home le dia per so que·l loc inscis no sia consolidat.	And accordingly, take wool and dip it in oil and pause that one on the location, and keep the patient at home for a day so that the inserted location is not consolidated.
Mays si le ciphac es gros e espes, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel am spatum lat o am fuelha de mirta.	But if the membrane is thick and dense, then accordingly it is necessary that you insert it with spatula or with myrtle leaves.
Mays si la oppilacio es per carnada, lahoras suspen aquela am unci, e inscideys aquela.	But if the swelling is due to inflammation, then accordingly suspend that one with a needle, and insert it.
E sian am tu las medicinas que fan cessar flux de sanc ses mordicacio, ayssi cum ahacatia, e sanc de drago, e enses, ajustat am album de huou.	And be familiar with the medicines that stop bleeding without biting, such as ahaemia, blood of dragon, and enses, adjusted to the album of urine.
E aprop aministra una canulha de plom ampla per so que la plagua no sia consolidada leugierament.	And accordingly, administer a leaden cannula of ample size so that the wound is not consolidated too quickly.
E tengua aquela per alcus jorns e aministra calgua de li sec.	And keep that one for several days and administer lukewarm water.
E aprop sia curada am l’autra curacio de consolidacio entro que sia sanada.	And accordingly, be cured with another cure of consolidation until it is healed.
E alcunas vetz accideys en la mayre nativitat de autres carns, e lahoras cove que inscidas segon aquesta manieyra.	And sometimes accidents occur in the natural birth of other flesh, and accordingly it is necessary that you insert according to this manner.
Mays si aysso es per apostema crancos, a l’apostema crancos le qual es en la mayre no sia fayta contrarietat am ferr en deguna manieyra.	But if it is due to gangrenous apostemes, then do not make any opposition with iron in any way regarding the gangrenous aposteme which is in the mother.
Capitol .lxxiii.	Seventy-third Chapter.
De la cura de emorroydas e de tayl e de botor roja que accideysso en le conh de las femnas.	Of the Cure of Hemorrhoids, Tumors and Red Boils that occur in the Clitoris of Women.
Emorroydas so apprecio dels orificis de motas venas entro que de aquelas corro mot sanc continuadament; e cum so antiquadas emorroydas e son fayts theyls.	Hemorrhoids are a kind of swelling of the orifices of many veins, until from those veins there flows blood continuously; and as hemorrhoids become old and their throats are formed.
E ja yeu he dit en la divisio las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e diyre ayssi aquelas que recebo curacio e aquelas que no recebo curacio.	And I have already said in the division of these species and their signs, and I will say here which receive cure and which do not receive cure.
Donc dic que emorroydas e theyls quan so en le preon de la mayre e no apparo al sentiment, lahoras en aquelas no sia fayta curacio am ferr.	Therefore I say that hemorrhoids and throats when they are in the abdomen of the mother and do not appear to the sense, then accordingly in those there is no cure with iron.
Mays aquelas las quals so en le orrifici de la mayre sobre las quals catz sentiment, so aquelas que so curadas.	But those which are in the orifice of the mother above which one feels sensation, those are the ones that can be cured.
E cove que tu metas la femna en mayso frega e aprop exten atheyl am les forfexs, o am drap aspre, e inscideys aquelas am las razitz.	And it is necessary that you put the woman in a warm bath and accordingly extend the throat with forceps or with rough cloth, and insert those into the roots.
E aprop pulveriza sobre aquelas deves le fluxs del sanc de una de las polveras insciscivas ses mordicacio, ayssi cum acassia e semblant ad aquels.	And accordingly powderize over those veins the flows of blood from one of the powders that are inserted without biting, just like acaena and similar to those.
E aprop enpellesca les sieus pes per una hora, e aprop pausa aquela en aygua freja.	And accordingly, apply pressure with her feet for one hour, and accordingly pause that one in cold water.
E si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras fay aquela sezer en decoccio de sumat e de scorsas de milgranas e de gualas e de semblantz.	And if the blood flow persists, then accordingly make that one to cease in a decoction of samphire and scorzonera roots and gallnuts and similar things.
E aprop pren farina de ordi e comfiys aquela am miel e vi agre e fay emplastre am aquo sobre le dos de lu.	And accordingly, take barley flour and mix it with honey and vinegar and make a poultice with water on the back of her.
E si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, fay adherir am dos ventozas, e a las mamilhas ses escarificatio.	And if the blood is stopped, it's good; and otherwise, make adhere with two poultices, and on the nipples without scarring.
E aprop pren lana e submergeys aquela am suc de coliandre o am suc de arnagloza o am suc de guarravier am vi pentit e fay adherir al loc; e aprop cura le loc am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly, take wool and submerge that one in the juice of colicandro or in the juice of arnoglossa or in the juice of guarravier mixed with vinegar, and make it adhere to the location; and accordingly cure the location with ointment until it is healed.
Mays athyl rog le qual es de aspre reguardament, cove que tu inscidas aquo que a tu appar de aquel segon que he dit en theyl engualment.	But the throat that has a rough regard, it is necessary that you insert there what appears to you from that one according to what I have said in the equal measurement.
E cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And cure that one until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxiv.	Seventy-fourth Chapter.
De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	Of the Perforation of Accidental Emission in the Mother.
Motas specias de apostemas accideysso en la mayre, ayssi cum cranc e apostema lapident e ulceracios e adhubelat e erpetromens e fistulas emorroyas e raguarrias e thyl e autres apostemas.	Many species of accidental apostemes occur in the mother, such as gangrene and apostematic lithotomy and ulcers and hubbub and herpetomenes and fistulous hemorrhoids and ravenous and throat and other apostemes.
E yeu ja he dit aquestas malautias e las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e las curacios de lor en la divisio.	And I have already said these diseases and their species and signs, and the cures for them in the division.
E cove que yeu digua en aquest tractat de apostema caut le qual ve en la mayre quan es dels apostemas que collegeysso sania, e si vols saber en qual manieyra se fa la opperacio de lu am ferr.	And it is necessary that you say in this treatise of gangrenous aposteme which occurs in the mother when it is one of those apostemes that are cured by means of surgery, and if you wish to know in what manner the operation is done with iron.
Adonc cove que tu consideres si la dolor de la apostema en le sieu comensament es aguda am percussio e flecma e febre, e vezes aquel enrogezir e si catz sobre aquel le sentiment, lahoras no·t coytes am perforacio de lu, e cura aquel am aquo que ajuda sobre la maturacio entro que cesse la acuitat dels accidentz.	Therefore it is necessary that you consider whether the pain of the gangrenous aposteme in its initial stage is sharp with percussion and pulse and fever, and if it becomes inflamed and if one feels sensation on that location, then do not cut with perforation of iron, but cure that one with water that helps with maturation until the acuity of the accidents ceases.
E lahoras cove que tu fassas cezer la femna sobre una cezelha que aia doas cezelhas; e recline sobre le sieu dos e ajusta les sieus pes a la partida pus dejos del ventre, e las sieus coyssas sian expandudas, e pausa les sieus brasses dejos les sieus denols, e lia quascus am liament ad aquo convenient.	And accordingly it is necessary that you make the woman lie on a pillow with two pillows; and recline on her back and adjust her feet to the lower part of the belly, and her arms be expanded, and pause her hands below her nails, and tie each one with a bandage to water as convenient.
E aprop la matrona segua del latz dreyt e aministre le instrument am le qual es ubert le orrifici de la mayre, la forma del qual vindra en aquelas causas que·s faran aprop.	And accordingly the midwife should follow the right direction and administer the instrument with which the orifice of the mother is opened, in the form which will come forth from those causes that will be appropriate.
E cove quan vols ministrar aquest instrument que tu fiques am lo ray le preon de la mayre de la femna, e aquo que del instrument es intrat en la mayre no sia mays que·l preon de la mayre e leda le malaute.	And accordingly when you want to administer this instrument, make it so that the ray is applied to the abdomen of the mother of the woman, and what enters into the mother from the instrument should not be more than the abdomen of the mother and guide the malady.
Mays si l’estrument es major que·l preon de la mayre, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils sobre la textura del preon de la mayre per sso que sia prohibit l’intrament de tot instrument en le preon de la mayre.	But if the instrument is larger than the abdomen of the mother, then accordingly it is necessary that you sprinkle powder on the texture of the abdomen of the mother so that it prevents the entrance of any instrument into the abdomen of the mother.
E cove que tu pauses le vertitge que corr en le strument del latz pus desus e que le ministre tengua le strument e revolva le vertitge entro que sia ubert le orrifici de la mayre.	And accordingly, you should pause the pivot that runs in the instrument from above and below, and the one who ministers should hold the instrument and turn the pivot until the orifice of the mother is opened.
E cum appar la excitura, e es tocada am la ma e es leon e molh, lahoras cove que tu secces aquela deves le cap de lu am spatum lat.	And when the excitation appears, and it is touched with the hand and is hot and moist, then accordingly it is necessary that you cut off that part from the head of the instrument with a spatula.
E cum la sania es evacuada, lahoras cove que tu pauses en la plagua una meca submersa en oli rozat o oli vert en le qual sia alcuna stiptisitat; e pausa la calca7 en la seccio en le preon de la mayre.	And when the pus is evacuated, then accordingly it is necessary that you pause in the wound a poultice submerged in rose oil or green oil which has some stinging properties; and pause the pressure on the section in the abdomen of the mother.
E pause deforo la mayre e sobre le pentenilh lana munda submersa en aygua en la qual sian bulidas malvas.	And pause above the mother's back and on the pubic area a clean wool submerged in water in which mauve flowers have been added.
E aprop sia curada aprop dos dias am enguent le qual conveneys ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly it is cured in two days with ointment which corresponds to that until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es lavada la mayre e la plagua enayssi que es cristerisat am aygua e mel, e aprop am aygua en la qual es bulhida razit de liri o de aristologia longua, e aprop retorna al enguent.	And sometimes the mother is washed and the wound in this way that it is anointed with water and honey, and accordingly with water in which rue or Aristolochia longa has been added, and accordingly returns to the ointment.
E si la plagua es dedintz en la mayre ameguada, lahoras cove que tu sias prohibit de la curacio de lu am ferr, habantz cura aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio.	And if the wound is deep in the mother's abdomen, then accordingly it is necessary that you be prohibited from the cure of that one with iron, having cured that one with water as we have said in the division.
Capitol .lxxv.	Seventy-fifth Chapter.
A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	To teach midwives in what manner they should be medicated when the bodies are sick according to a non-natural figure.
Necessaria causa es que la matrona conogua en le comensament la figura del enfantament natural per senhals de lu, e es que quan tu vezas la femna expremar a las partidas dejos e desira odorar le ayre, e sobre aquo es enleujada per aquo que sobre ela es del part, e festina le eyssiment del enbrio, lahoras sapias que aquest part es segon figura natural, e es l’eyssiment de lu sobre le sieu cap, e la segondina am aquel o suspensa o pendent del ombelic.	A necessary cause is that the midwife knows in the beginning the figure of normal childbirth by its signs, and it is that when you see the woman expelling her contents at the lower part and desiring to smell the air, and above that she is relaxed because what is coming out from her is the part, and hasten the delivery of the fetus, then you know that this part is according to natural figure, and it is the delivery of the child on its head, and the umbilical cord suspended or pending from the navel.
Donc cum tu vezes aquels senhals, lahoras cove que·l ventre de lu sia compremut per so que l’embrio deysenda leugerament quar quan deyssen sobre le sieu cap, deysen a lu la segondina, e es mondada de aquelas superfluitatz am bona mondificacio.	Therefore, when you see those signs, it is necessary that the belly of the child be compressed so that the fetus descends slightly, and when they come out on its head, they are delivered to it, and it is cleansed of those superfluities with good cleansing.
Mays aquel que es otra aquest part es no-natural e no-lausable, quar quan le enbrio es eyssit sobre sos pes e·l cos de lu es eyssit devant le cap de lu e·ls pes de lu, e la ma de lu una, o al pe de lu .i., o es eyssit le cap de lu e la ma de lu, o al ventre de lu, e fort leu es convertit sobre le sieu col, e semblant de las figuras de lu no-lausablas.	But that which is another part is non-natural and not to be trusted, for when the fetus is delivered with its feet first and the child's body is delivered in front of its head and its feet, one hand or at the foot... or is delivered with the head of the child and one hand or at the belly of the child, and very rarely it is turned on its back, and resembling the figures of non-natural childbirth.
Don necessaria causa es a la matrona que sia savia e subtil en totas aquelas causas, e que·s guarde de error e de decepcio.	Therefore it is necessary that the midwife be wise and subtle in all those causes, and that she guard against error and deception.
E yeu so mostrant tota figura de aquelas, e qual engen es en aquelas per so que sia significat per aquo e sia stat sobre aquo.	And I am showing you all the figures of those, and what power is in them, so that they may be significant by this and stand on that.
Quan le feyt es eyssit sobre le sieu cap per egrecio natural, e aquel es vehement sobre la femna e es fayt a lu part dificil, e vezes la vertut de lu ja debelitada, lahoras fay aquela sezer , o que las femnas tenguan lu, e evapora le conh de lu am fenugrec coyt e am olis humitz.	When the child is born on its head by natural extraction, and it is vehement over the woman and made to part with difficulty, and sometimes the virtue of the woman is already debilitated, then accordingly make that one cease, or what women have, and evaporate the menses with fenugreek and humectant oils.
E aprop entrometa la metrona entre les sieus ditz espatum petit e fenda am aquel la segondina, o secce aquela am la sua ungla entro que corro aquo que es en ela de humiditat.	And accordingly insert the midwife between her said small spatula and a slit in that one, or cut that one with its own nail until it flows forth what is in her of humidity.
E preme le ventre de la femna entro que deyssenda le fet.	And press the woman's belly until the fetus descends.
Mays si no deyssen, lahoras cove que la femna sia cristirizada de mucellage de ptilli e mucellage de fenugrec am cizami.	But if it doesn't descend, then accordingly the woman should be anointed with mummy of papyrus and mummy of fenugreek mixed with camomile.
E aprop comanda a lu, aprop le cristeri, que sia compremuda e fay aquela stornudar am condisi; e te la boca de lu e·l nas de lu per huna hora, quar le fet sira foro-getat tantost.	And accordingly command her to be anointed with it, and accordingly the anointing should be compressed and make that one sneeze with conditions; and take away her mouth and nose from her for an hour, because the fetus will soon forget about it.
E si las doas mas del fet so foro-getadas al comensament, lahoras cove que tu redusiscas aquelas am fecilitat petit a petit.	And if two of the fetus's hands are forgotten at the beginning, then accordingly you should reduce those with small ease little by little.
Mays si no obezeys al intrament, lahoras pausa la femna sobre una cezelha e leva les pes de lu sus, e aprop concuceys la cezelha sobre la terra; e la femna sia tenguda que no caia deves la concussio.	But if it does not obey the instrument, then accordingly pause the woman on a pillow and lift her feet up, and accordingly conceive the pillow on the earth; and the woman should be held so that she does not fall from the concussion.
E si las mas no son dedintz tornadas e morr le fet, lahoras inscideys aquelas e extratz le romament del fet o lia le cors a la ma de lu am drap e extratz aquel am equalitat, quar aquel sira foro-getat.	And if the hands are not returned and the fetus dies, then accordingly insert those and extract the remnant of the fetus or tie its body to her hand with cloth and extract that one with equality, because it will soon be forgotten.
De eyssiment del embrio sobre les sieus pes.	Of the Delivery of the Fetus on Its Feet.
Quan le fet yeys sobre les sieus pes, lahoras cove que tu impelliscas aquels en sus, e aprop convertas le fet petit, e aprop que engualhes aquel, e aprop que prenguas un pe de lu e extendas aquels petit a petit.	When the fetus is born on its feet, then accordingly you should push those inwards, and accordingly turn the fetus little by little, and accordingly bring one foot of it and stretch those little by little.
Mays cum son eyssit entro a las coyssas, lahoras tu comanda a lu que se exprema, e fay aquela extornudar am condizi, quar sira foro-getat si Deus lo vol.	But when they are born into the arms, then accordingly you should command her to expel, and make that one sneeze with conditions, because it will soon be forgotten if God so wills.
E si no es foro-getat am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras tu retorna le fet petit a petit entro que pauses aquel segon figura natural, quar aquel sira lahoras foro-getat am leugier eyssiment.	And if it is not forgotten according to what we have recounted, then accordingly you should return the fetus little by little until it pauses in its natural figure, because it will soon be forgotten with a lighter delivery.
E si es prohibit am tot aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras pren de musellage de altea e de goma dissolvuda, e percuteys tot en le mortier per bona percussio, e aprop linieys am aquo le conh de la femna, el pus bas del ventre de lu.	And if it is prohibited according to all that we have recounted, then accordingly take mummy of alta and dissolved gum, and strike the whole in the mortar with good striking, and accordingly line up with water the woman's menses, at the lowest part of her belly.
E aprop fay aquela cezer en aygua tebeza, entro que consegua les ypocondias.	And accordingly make that one cease in hot water, until it achieves the hypochondria.
E cum vezes que las partidas dejos de lu so lenificadas, lahoras fay a lu subfumiguacio de mirta e sub-pausa aquela a lu.	And when the parts below are relaxed, then accordingly make her take a sub-fumigation of myrtle and pause that one for her.
E quan te la sub-fumiguacio per una hora, lahoras tu la fay sezer sobre una cezelha, e aprop fay aquela stornudar e extrenh la boca de lu, e levas de aquela, e prem la partida pus bassa del ventre de lu am leugiera compressio, quar le fet sira tantost foro-getat.	And when she has taken the sub-fumigation for an hour, then accordingly make her lie on a pillow, and accordingly make that one sneeze and stretch out her mouth, and take away from that, and press the lower part of her belly with light compression, because the fetus will soon be forgotten.
Eyssiment del fet sobre les sieus denols e las suas mas.	Delivery of the Fetus on Its Elbows and Hands.
Quan le fet eyssira segon aquesta forma, lahoras tu engenies en entrometen las suas mas petit a petit; e aprop la femna stia evessada sobre le sieu col, e les pes de lu pengo en jos, e aquelas sia jasent sobre le lieyt, e complegua las suas mas.	When the fetus is delivered in this way, then accordingly you should gently insert its hands little by little; and accordingly the woman should be lying on her back, with her feet hanging down, and those hands resting on the light, and complete its hands.
E aprop prem sobre le ventre de lu petit a petit, e aprop extratz aquo que es dejos les pes de lu de las aurelhas entro que sia preparada en la partida pus dejos.	And accordingly press on the woman's belly little by little, and accordingly extract that which is left over from her feet to the armpits, until it is prepared in the lower part.
E si le fet no es fora-getat, lahoras pren les pes de lu e mau aquels am movement vehement, e aprop prem aquo que es sobre les ypocondres petit a petit entro que le fet puege a las partidas desus.	And if the fetus is not forgotten, then accordingly take her feet and move them violently, and accordingly press that which is above the hypochondria little by little until the fetus reaches the upper parts.
E aprop entrometa las suas mas e engualhe le fet petit a petit, e comanda a la femna que se exprema entro que le fet sia foro-getat.	And accordingly insert its hands and bring the fetus little by little, and command the woman to expel until the fetus is forgotten.
Eyssiment del fet latutidinalment pendent una de las suas mas.	Delivery of the Fetus Lying Transverse with One of Its Hands Hanging Down.
Sia engeniat en reduccio de la ma de lu, mays si no podes aquela reduzir, lahoras eleva la femna e fe aquela anar.	Be gentle in reducing the woman's hand, but if you cannot reduce that one, then accordingly lift the woman and make her walk.
E si anar no pot, lahoras fay la jazer sobre le lieyt, e concuteys las coyssas de lu am concussio vehement, e aprop aministra liamentz les quals yeu e recomtatz de mucillages.	And if she cannot walk, then accordingly make her lie on the bed, and conceive the woman's arms with a violent concussion, and accordingly administer those remedies which you and we have recounted from mummy.
E si es vengut le enfantament, lahoras fay aquela sezer sobre cezelha, e aprop studia sobre la reduccio de la ma, e enguala le fet segon figura natural, e fay stornudar la femna e comanda a lu que comprema a si entro que sia foro-getat.	And if the childbirth is over, then accordingly make her lie on a pillow, and accordingly study the reduction of the hand, and bring forth the fetus according to natural figure, and make the woman sneeze and command her to compress herself until it is forgotten.
Eyssiment del fet sobre·l col expandudas las suas mas e la fassia de lu es al dos de la sua mayre.	Delivery of the Fetus with its hands spread out and the woman's flesh on both sides of her mother.
Cove que la matrona tengua la ma del fet e aprop revolva aquel petit a petit, e eque aquel am facilitat.	It is necessary that the midwife hold the hand of the fetus and accordingly turn it little by little, and make it easy for that one.
E cum es e quant so es engualhat, e lahoras pausa sobre le conh de lu aquo que havem recomtat de oli e de mucellages.	And when it is equalized, and accordingly pause on the menses of that one with what we have recounted from oils and mummy.
E aprop comandas a lu que·s maugua petit a petit, e quan auras feyt aquo, lahoras fay aquela cezer sobre una cezelha e comanda li que sia inclinada sobre le latz dreyt, e aprop comanda a lu que sia compremuda; e fay aquela stornudar am condizi.	And accordingly command her to cough little by little, and when you have finished that, then accordingly make her lie on a pillow and command her to incline herself over the right side, and accordingly command her to be compressed; and make that one sneeze with conditions.
Exitus foetus praeparati super latus.	Exit of the Prepared Fetus Above the Side.
Quan deyssen a horrifici de la mayre segon aquesta manieyra, considera, e lahoras tu inscideys la segondina am la tua ungla entro que sia evacuada de la humiditat.	When the child is born in a terrifying manner according to this method, consider, and accordingly you should insert the second finger with your nail into that one until it is evacuated of humidity.
E si le fet es suspendut sobre la cara e·l col de lu, lahoras tu inscideys aquela del embelic, per so que no sia retengut e mora.	And if the fetus is suspended over the face and neck of her, then accordingly you should insert that one from the umbilicus, so that it may not be retained and die.
E aprop empelleys le fet a las partidas dedintz entro que pauses aquel segon que cove, e manda a la femna que comprema a si alcunas veguadas, e el sira fora-getat am eyssiment leugier, si Dieus o vol.	And accordingly push the fetus into the lower parts until it pauses according to what is necessary, and command the woman to compress herself several times, and if God so wills, it will be forgotten with a lighter delivery.
Exitus geminorum aut foetuum multorum.	Exit of Twins or Many Fetuses.
Sapias que gemels motas veguadas so natz, e alcunas vetz naysso tres o quatre , mays aquo es estranh e tart s’endeve; mays v so causas foro natura, e no vivo.	Know that twins are often born in sets of two or three, and sometimes even four, but this is rare and should not happen; but there are causes that are against nature, and do not live.
E conte aquelas, ja sia que sian montiplicatz, una segondina, e son seperatz per ciphac, distingen aquels enter le liguament en l’ombilic de cascun de aquels E alcunas veguadas so foro-getatz ayssi cum es un fet per eyssiment natural leugier, e so eysitz alcunas veguadas per eyssiment no-lausabla ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And in those cases, whether they are multiple or not, one second fetus, and they are separated by ciphac, distinguish those into the ligament at the umbilicus of each of them. And sometimes they are forgotten like this, as if it were one fetus for a lighter delivery, and sometimes they are delivered non-naturally like we have recounted.
E si son dificils alcus de lor deves le enfantament e perveno ad aquo que havem dit de las figuras no-naturals, lahoras tu cura aquels ayssi cum havem recontat.	And if some of them are difficult to deliver and proceed according to what we have said about the non-natural figures, then accordingly you should care for those like we have recounted.
E si’ la matrona subtil e fassa aquo que fa am facilitat e subtilitat, e am tarditat, e sia ingeniat segon tota figura segon que es a lu preparat de l’engen amenant a salut.	And if the midwife is subtle and does that which facilitates ease and subtlety, and with delay, and is gentle according to all figure, as it is prepared from the beginning leading to health.
Rememoratio eius quod formatur in matrice ex embrionibus et Abortiuntur.	Remembrance of what is formed in the womb from embryos and aborted fetuses.
Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis.	Some women are formed in the womb to have one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, and even ten children, and you should verify that a woman aborts nine times and another has all ten, which is caused by the measurement of the wise sages.
E tot aysso cove que sia en la sciencia de la matrona quar fort leu ad aquela parve semblant de aquo, e donc opause se ad aquo am so que cove.	And all this is necessary in the science of the midwife, for it is a great deal that appears like this to her, and therefore pause should be made at this point with what is necessary.
Capitol .lxxvi.	Chapter 76.
De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	On the extraction of the fetus when it is dead.
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio.	When you care for the dead fetus with what we have said in the division of medicine and it is not born outside, and you are forced to use an operation on her, then accordingly it is necessary that you consider whether the woman has a healthy virtue and is not affected by any of the accidents by which on her there is feared loss.
Lahoras cove que la femna sia envessada sobre le lieyt sobre le sieu dos, e sia le cap de lu enclinat enjos e las coyssas de lu sian elevadas.	Then accordingly it is necessary that the woman be laid on her back on a bed or pillow, and her head be inclined downward and her arms elevated.
E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	And the minister should hold that one by two parts or tie her in a bed for so that the body of hers does not extend too far during the extraction of the fetus.
E aprop tu humecta la boca de la mayre de lu am olis humitz e am mucellage de altea e de fenugrec e de semensa de li.	And accordingly you should moisten the mouth of her womb with olive oil and mummy of alta and fenugreek and seed of lily.
E aprop unte la matrona la sua ma am aquels olis e mucellages, e aprop entrometa la sua ma am fecilitat en la mayre, e aprop cerque am la ma loc en le qual fique les uncis en le fet.	And accordingly the midwife should take her hand with those oils and mummy, and accordingly insert her hand with ease into the womb, and accordingly search for the location where the fingers will be placed on the fetus.
E locs convenient en aquo: adonc tu considera si le fet es preparat que deysenda sobre le sieu cap, e lahoras tu fique les uncis en les huels de lu, o en le col, o en la boca, o en le palat, o dejos la barba, o en la furcula de lu, o en les locs propdas de las costas, o dejos les ypocondres.	And when you have found the convenient location: then accordingly you should consider if the fetus is prepared to come out on its head, and accordingly place your fingers in the hollow of the skull, or in the neck, or in the mouth, or on the palate, or below the beard, or in the furcula of the skull, or in the places proper for the ribs, or below the hypochondria.
Mays si le deysendiment es sobre les pes de lu, lahoras en le pentenilh, o en le mieg de las costas.	But if the delivery is over the feet of hers, then accordingly in the pelvis or in the middle of the ribs.
E cove que tengua le unci am la ma dreyta, e pausa la curvitat de lu en aquel loc le qual es entre les ditz de la ma senestra, e entrometa la ma am facilitat e fique le unci en alcu de aquels locs les quals havem ditz, entro que pervengua a la causa boyda.	And accordingly you should hold the fingers with your right hand, and pause the curvature of hers in that location which is between the said fingers of your left hand, and insert your hand with ease and place the fingers in one of those locations which we have said, until you reach the cause of birth.
E aprop pause e fique en la apposicio de lu un autre unci, o le tertz si es necessitat, per so que sia atraccio engual, e no sia extencio segon la sua rectetut tant solament.	And accordingly you should pause and remain in the position of hers another finger, or the third if it is necessary, in order that there may be a gentle attraction, and not an extension according to her natural straightness only.
Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	And it is good for all parts, in order that the delivery of hers may be facilitated as if it were done by hand.
E cove en lu aquo que es entre lor que la extencio sia mollificada; e si alcuna partida de lu es retenguda, lahoras cove que la matrona unte alcus sieus ditz am oli e entrometa aquels espertament e revolva am aquels aquo que es retengut.	And it is good in her that which is between them, so that the extension may be softened; and if some part of hers is retained, then accordingly the midwife should apply some of her said fingers with oil and insert those expertly and turn around with what is retained.
