Donc si la partida del fet es fora-getada, lahoras les uncis sian permudatz entra loc le qual sia pus aut; e fay aysso entro que tot le fet sia fora-getat.	Therefore if the part of the fetus is forgotten, then accordingly the fingers should be permitted to enter that location which is higher up; and make it so until all the fetus is brought forth.
Mays si la ma es eyssida denant l’autra, e no es possible reduzir aquela per la coartacio de lu, lahoras cove que drap sia envolopat sobre aquela; e aprop extratz aquela entro que tota sia fora-getada, e inscideys aquela o en la junctura de la ma o en le coyde.	But if the hand is stuck in front of the other, and it is not possible to reduce that one by the constriction of hers, then accordingly it is necessary that cloth be wrapped around that one; and accordingly extract that one until all is brought forth, and insert it either at the joint of the hand or in the elbow.
E ayssi cove que fassas en l’autra ma e en les dos pes.	And so it is necessary to do the same in the other hand and in both feet.
Mays si le cap del fet es gran, o accideys a lu coartacio en le eyssiment, o es en le cap de lu aygua ajustada, lahoras cove que entrometa entre les ditz espatum spinos e fenda le cap e extragua la aygua, o que discroba aquel am un instrument le qual es nompnat “alundat”, la forma del qual vindra am las formas dels autres instruments en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	But if the head of the fetus is large, or if there is constriction during the delivery, or if there is water adjusted in the head of hers, then accordingly it is necessary to insert between the said spiny spatula and make an incision on the head and extract the water, or what discloses that one with a tool which is called "alundat", whose form will come with the forms of other instruments in the capital chapter which is apropos to this.
E semblantment fassa si·l fet es de gran cap per natura: e lahoras cove que inscida aquel am algematu, o que prengua aquel am alunda ayssi cum havem dit; e aprop extra les osses am les forceps.	And similarly do the same if the fetus is naturally large-headed: and accordingly it is necessary to incise that one with an allegator, or take that one with an alundat as we have said; and accordingly extract the bones with forceps.
E si le cap es eyssit e es coartat deves la furcula, lahoras sia fendut entro que la humiditat la qual es en le pietz sia efunduda.	And if the head is extracted and is constricted at the furcula, then accordingly it should be incised in order that the humidity which is in the feet may be poured out.
Mays si no es complicat, ni obezeys a eyssiment, lahoras tu inscideys le cap tantost segon que a tu sira possible.	But if it is not complicated nor obedient to delivery, then accordingly you should incise the head as soon as possible according to what will be possible for you.
E si le dejos del ventre es apostemat o es en lu ydropici, lahoras cove que tu perfores aquel entro que corro la humiditat que es en lu.	And if the afterbirth is apostematic or is in water retention, then accordingly it is necessary that you perforate that one until the humidity which is in hers flows out.
Mays si le fet es sobre les sieus pes, lahoras la atraccio de lu es leugiera e la direccio de lu a la boca de la mayre es leugiera.	But if the fetus is on her feet, then accordingly the attraction of hers is light and the direction to her mouth is light.
Mays si es coartat deves le ventre e·l pietz, lahoras cove que tu extraguas aquel am drap le qual auras envolopat sobre la tua ma, e que fendes le ventre e·l pietz entro que corra aquo que es en aquels.	But if it is constricted by the belly and feet, then accordingly it is necessary that you extract that one with cloth which you will have wrapped around your hand, and that you incise the belly and feet until the water which is in those flows out.
Mays si les autres membres so ostatz e torna le cap, lahoras la metrona entrometa la ma senestra; mays si la boca de la mayre es huberta, lahoras intrometa la ma en le preon de layre, e cerque am aquela le cap, e atira aquel am les ditz entro a la boca de la mayre, e aprop entrometa en lu un unci, o dos uncis, e atire lu am aquels.	But if the other members are stuck and return to the head, then accordingly insert your left hand; but if the mouth of hers is swollen, then accordingly insert your hand into the prepuce of her, and search for that one's head, and attract it with those fingers until it enters into the mouth of hers, and accordingly insert one or two fingers and draw hers towards those.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas.	And if the mouth of hers is constricted by apostematic swelling which occurs in her, then accordingly it is not necessary to trouble about that; but before administering effusion of humid and greasy causes.
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	And administer poultices; and follow the patient in waters that soften and moisten.
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	And if the fetus is on her ribcage, then accordingly it should be, if possible, sewn; and administered water as we have said in the live fetus.
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	And if this is not possible, then accordingly it should be incised in pieces, and extracted.
E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	And accordingly one should not leave any cause behind the second finger.
E cum tu auras complida tota la tua opperacio, lahoras aministra aquo que havem dit de la curacio en les apostemas cautz les quals accideysso de la mayre.	And when you have completed all your operation, then accordingly administer the water as we have said for curing of apostematic swellings which occur in her.
E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	And if there occurs a flow of blood, then accordingly send it down in stiptic waters and administer the other cure.
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	And you have already seen a woman whose womb was dead, and accordingly on that same spot another pregnancy was undertaken, and accordingly the fetus is another.
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	It happened to her that after a long time an apostema occurred in her umbilicus; and it swelled up into a boil, and began to burst forth.
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	And you were called to her cure, and treated her for a long time, and the wound did not consolidate.
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	Then you applied some causes of strong attraction to her, and extracted one bone from her, and accordingly passed some days, and extracted another bone; and you were too amazed, since in the womb there was no bone.
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	And then you thought that they were the bones of the dead fetus.
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	Therefore you covered the wound, and extracted many bones from her, the woman existing in her own millenary dispositions, and already living in such a manner for a long time, and corrected herself with a small piece of flesh.
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	And you did not hesitate to say that it was strange, but rather because in this is science and aid to what the physician has with his hand for curing.
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	Of the forms of instruments which are necessary for extracting the fetus.
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	The shape of the vice in which the mother is opened.
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the shape of a strengthener in which the free ends are joined together by two vice-like contraptions at both extremities of two feet.
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	And however this vice should be more subtle than the strictor, and made of ebony or boxwood.
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	And the diameter of each stick is two fingers and a little more, and the margin of each is one finger, and the length of each is one palm and a half; and in the middle location of two sticks are two adjustments of those sticks which are already fixed, the length of which is half a palm and a little more, and the diameter of each is two fingers or a little more.
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	And these two adjustments are inserted into the mouth of the mother so that they can be opened with those when you turn the two prescribed vice-like contraptions.
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	Another similar form, more subtle and lighter:
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	It should be made of ebony or boxwood according to the shape of forceps.
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	However, at the end of it there are two additional pieces like those, and the length of those additional pieces is one palm, and the diameter of each is two fingers.
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	And when you want to open the mother with those, then accordingly you should cause the woman to lean back on her bed, with her feet hanging down, and open what is between her thighs.
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	And accordingly place your hand with the instrument as you would with forceps, in equal measure according to the quantity that you want of the appreciation of the mouth of the mother, until she does what you want.
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	The form of vice which the ancients called:
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	Form of impeller, with which the fetus is impelled.
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	Form of Amisidate, with which the great head is contained.
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.	And it is assembled to forceps which have teeth at the end, just like times, and some times are made long just like forceps according to this form, just like times, with teeth just like the teeth of a saw blade into which it is inserted and contained.
Forma de amesidat pauc:	Form of Amisidate little:
Forma de unci havent una spina:	Form of finger having a spine:
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	Form of finger having two spines:
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	Form of forceps to which teeth are attached like those of a saw, with which the head of the fetus is contained.
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	Form of spatula having two extremities with which the head is cut off.
Forma de dos espatums latz:	Form of two broad spatulas:
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	All those instruments are exercised, and when more species of that and prepared by the artisans, as much as it is lighter for their operation and more numerous are the people for their quantity.
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	And you must not omit to prepare those instruments, whatever they may be, because the necessity of them is not excusable.
De extraccio de la segondina.	Of the extraction of the second finger.
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the second finger is retained, you must command the child to retain its right hand, and accordingly make her sneeze with conditions, and strengthen your hand on the mouth of hers and on her nostrils, and if by so it has emerged outside, it is good.
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	And if not, then accordingly take a ball and pierce a hole in the cover, pause in that herb and fill the mouth of the mother with it, just like with celandine and rue and anise and chamomile and Arabic senna and cassia lignea and safflower.
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	All these herbs or some of them are submerged in water in the ball, and pause it on the fire.
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	And accordingly place a cane from flax in the mouth of the mother, and hold it until the vapor comes out into the concavity of the mother.
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	And accordingly make her sneeze just as we have said, and the second finger will be expelled with speed.
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	But if this cure does not work and the second finger remains, then accordingly command the midwife to submerge her left hand in sesame oil or in a mixture of altarion, and accordingly insert that into the conic cavity and search for the second finger, and when you have found it, then take it and stretch it little by little. But if it is annexed to the womb of the mother, then accordingly insert your hand according to what we have recounted, and when you have found the second finger, extract it little by little according to the rule, so that the mother does not suffer from excessive attraction.
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	And accordingly it should be facilitated on both right and left sides with ease.
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	And accordingly it should be adjusted in the quantity of attraction, since it will obey and escape from adherence.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	And if the mouth of the mother is constricted, as we have already recounted the cure with sneezing and medication from the ball with herbs.
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	But if it is not expelled with all the causes which we have recounted, then accordingly take heed that you do not force it upon her in iteration of abstraction, but rather it should be brought to the mouth of the mother and placed at the cleft of the woman, and accordingly make it crusty with egg white and tetra-pharmacum; for that will cause it to rot away after a few days and be dissolved.
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	But when it rots away, it rises to the head, and to the stomach, and leads the patient astray; and accordingly it is necessary that sub-fumigations and conveniences are administered accordingly.
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	But some of the Ancients have already experimented with sub-fumigation of Nazitort and dried figs.
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	Form of instrument with which the woman is sub-fumigated for the retention of menses and the second finger:
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	It should be made of beryl or horn.
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	And it should be paused with the subtle extremity in the cavity and the broad extremity above the fire, and the sub-fumigation should be paused on the arms of the fire.
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	And hold that in until the sub-fumigation is consumed and iterate another one.
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	Of the cure for the unbroken navel of the child.
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	Many children are born with navels that are not perforated, those which have already become subtle and opaque.
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	Then accordingly instruct the midwife to pierce that navel with her finger; and if not, then pierce it with a sharp spatula, and be careful not to touch the liver.
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	And accordingly pause on that navel, pouring in wine and oil; and accordingly cure it with egg white until it is clean.
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	But if you fear that it may become opaque, then accordingly pause a tube in the navel for several days, and stop when the child wants to pass stool.
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	And if the navel becomes opaque due to consolidation of wound or aposteme; then accordingly it should be incised, and accordingly cured with the water which we have said for the cure and the lead.
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	Of the cure for fistulas that remain behind.
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	The fistulas that remain in the departure, which are lower than the navel and thicker, those which remain near the anus outside or in the space of one side.
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is a single fistula or multiple ones.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	And when that nodule is ancient and flows with white watery fluid or subtle pus, and some times it has some of these fistulas penetrating.
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	And those penetrating ones are known by what comes out of them through excretion and windiness; and sometimes the patient uses the method of excretion, and very little is expelled from those worms.
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	And some of those fistulas penetrate into the space, entering the bladder and the urethra; and some of those penetrating ones enter the junction of the cleft and the notch of the clitoris.
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	And the way to know if a penetrating fistula is not penetrating is that you insert your finger into the anus and gently probe with a subtle instrument of horn or iron in the fistula when there is no resistance.
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	But if there is resistance in that, then accordingly insert into it a subtle instrument of lead or horsehair until you feel the instrument or hair in your finger.
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you don't feel it at all nor proceed from the tube any cause of emission or worm or windiness, just as we have said, then accordingly know that it is not penetrating, and accordingly give up the cure.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula is penetrating into the bladder or urethra, then accordingly its significance is evident from the urine of that and prohibition of it to be so, in order that the place may be consolidated with medicine.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	But if it is penetrating into the junction of the cleft or into the bone and causing pain in the circuit, then accordingly its sign is that the instrument will pass through here if there is no resistance in the bone, and causing pain in the circuit of the departure; and that from there you will have pus always; and that it will not be cured by medicine, nor consolidated with egg white.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all those penetrating fistulas there is no complete cure, and the cure of those is labor and toil of skilled physicians on which we have fixed.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in that which is not penetrating and not ancient, expectation of healing with iron is hoped for according to what we have recounted, and what has already been proved.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And so the patient lies between your two hands and raises their knees to theirs, the clefts being inclined towards the belly of the patient, and accordingly insert a lead or horn instrument into the fistula if there is resistance, until you know the place where the instrument can pass.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if the patient feels pain around the navel, then accordingly you should insert your finger into the navel.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel the instrument already having passed through and beginning to penetrate, or if you feel between your finger and that siphac or flesh, then accordingly you know for certain that it is penetrating; and then do not labor on that, since there is no healing in that, just as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	But however, some say that it can be cured in certain men.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And the medicine by which it is hoped for recovery in that is that you burn a subtle cauter, according to the size of the fistula, just as we have said before, and insert that ignited into the fistula until it spreads around the navel; and accordingly repeat that two or three times until you know that all those adjusted flesh-tubes are fixed, which resemble the feathers of an owl.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And accordingly cure that with calomel wraps wrapped in parchment, until all those adjusted flesh-tubes are cleansed; and accordingly cure that with medicines that generate and consolidate the flesh, and if it is healed, good is; and otherwise, it will not be healed at any time by other treatment.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the instrument enters and does not penetrate into the navel which is in the anus, and between that and the instrument which is a velamen of flesh or ciphac, and sometimes the fistula opens in what appears to be the surface of the skin, then accordingly dry the skin from the beginning of the fistula, and you will see it drying with the instrument, and it will be in the fistula until the drying reaches the location where the extremity of the instrument is, and through the instrument is liberated and cut.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And accordingly cleanse those flesh-tubes which are assembled like the feathers of an owl, and do not remain any cause.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	But if a flux of blood comes out sometimes when you are cleaning those flesh-tubes, then accordingly take the milk that is and of the pus, it is to cauterize with fire or acute medicine, for cauterizing with fire adjusts two good habits: first, adjustment of those adjusted flesh-tubes, and secondly, abscission of the blood from excessive humidity.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And accordingly cure that with calomel wraps wrapped in parchment or in threefold cloth until the wound gets better, and accordingly cure the wound with egg white, hard flesh generating and consolidating.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And thus medicines in which there is astringency and excess; when accordingly it is restored, it is already healed and you do not fear iteration.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	But if the fistula has already penetrated into the cavity of the anus and is prolonged from the surface of the body, then accordingly insert your finger into the anus and investigate with it.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And thus if you find the instrument and between you and it is a velamen of ciphac or flesh, and it is intended for penetration, then accordingly there will be no operation in that place, but only according to the way of faith and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	Which cause is to be administered in one of three ways: either to cauterize that as we have said; or to dry it until you achieve the conquest of it so that it becomes possible for you to insert the instruments and the cure intended; and not proceed with drying at all because you do not want to excise the liver containing the navel, and the patient's wish is to come true; and accordingly cure that with what we have said, since it will be healed very quickly; or to lengthen that velamen and clean up that pus that dries out that area into the proper anus, as we have said, either with a probe or another sharp instrument of sharp extremity, and accordingly cleanse those flesh-tubes which are in the section until you can see through it; and accordingly strive to make the restoration of all the wound with drying, and if the upper opening is not consolidated, and the fistula remains open in the departure of the anus, and becomes easier for the patient.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes the fistula is ended according to this manner: when you insert the instrument into the fistula, and it is in the lateral part of the anus around the surface of the body with the skin and on the margin of the anus, then take hold of the perforated extremity, which is like a needle prepared for sewing according to this form:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert it into that faithful wrap of five folds or around those, and accordingly insert the instrument with faith into the fistula until you achieve the conquest of it.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	But if it is penetrating in the margin of the anus, then accordingly you extract the thread from that tube and insert your finger into the anus; and extract the extremity of the thread and adjust the two ends together, and strengthen each one, and leave it like that for a day or two, and when more the thread is inserted into the flesh, strengthen it until those flesh-tubes are extracted which are between the two ends of the thread and fall.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And accordingly cure the wound until it is consolidated and healed.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	But if the orifice of the fistula is not penetrating, then accordingly make it penetrate in whatever way you are prepared, but not in the cavity, for it is not up to you to do that lest you excise the liver; and accordingly do that until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The form of the spatula spine with which the fistula is opened: its curvature is very sharp and the other part is non-sharp, so that you do not excise anything that is not necessary, just as sometimes.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	Of the suturing of hemorrhoids in which blood flows during the incision of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are according to two manners, for either they are between the anus resembling charcoal, or else those are like a bunch of raisins.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And those are small and large, and the blood flows from them constantly and is one, or many, and outside the anus, and in the extremities of it.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	But however, those that are outside the anus are according to the measures of little moisture, from which citrine water or a small amount of blood with continuous flesh flows, and according to the color of the flesh.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the cure for that which is outside the anus is to command the patient to settle down and to express themselves into the anus until it opens and the hemorrhoids appear before you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you take hold of it and suspend with the hooks or whatever instruments you have at your disposal, and accordingly cut away those hemorrhoids along their roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	But if the hooks are not taken in those because of their moisture and softening, then accordingly take those with a rough cloth or with a piece of cloth or with a woolen rag, and extract them with your fingers, and accordingly cut away those hemorrhoids and powder some powders over them around the incision, so that they become attached to those at the place of cauterization; or cauterize those according to what is precedented in the chapter on cauterizing.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And accordingly cure those with another cure until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the anus does not obey evacuation, then accordingly anoint the patient with anointing oil in which there is a small biting, and wash it with that water that is in the anus and make it obey evacuation slightly when the patient has evacuated.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then accordingly the cause of their being is easy, and it is that you take those with your finger or with hooks, and cut away those, and accordingly cure those with water as we have said until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And whoever will make incision, must administer suturing of them according to this manner: take a thread wrapped and insert that into the needle and accordingly extract the hemorrhoids at the upper parts, and make it penetrate through the root of the other part, and envelop the two ends of the thread in the most distant part of the needle, and so laterally; and strengthen the hemorrhoid with strong suturing, and accordingly tie off the thread and extract the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And do this to all of them, and leave one and not cut it off, in order that the superfluity of blood may flow from that.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	And accordingly place a cloth soaked in rose oil or cerote on the anus, and place that over it and command the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly leave it until it is closed; and when it is closed, cure those with egg whites or another cure until it is healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	The treatment of fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Many times accidents occur due to excessive tearing or constriction of nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And since they are so ancient and do not respond to that medicine, then accordingly you must cut away those parts with the point of a spatula or your finger until they become moist and the excess flesh above is absorbed by those, which prevents consolidation; and accordingly cure those until they are consolidated.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then accordingly you must cut away those parts with a reason more violent than the first one, until they bleed and are excoriated; and accordingly cure those until they are healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	The treatment of Almesamar, that is the key.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	Know that Almesamar is the key, and it is not so if not according to the color of the flesh like a cap of chivalry, and it is made throughout the body and especially in the parts below the feet and those said above, and thus one must use force by means of those pains to drive away love.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And then it is necessary to incise that which is in the cavity of the key, and to keep it with forceps or hooks, and to eradicate its root; and accordingly cure that.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, cauterize it according to what is preceded in the chapter on cauterizing.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	But truly, warts are small, hard, round nodules on the surface of the skin, and many times they appear on children's faces.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the cure for it is to stretch and incise that, or to strengthen that with a thread or skin until it closes.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you wish, cauterize it, according to what we have said, with fire or acute medicine.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And already they are eradicated on both sides and on both sides with the instrument which I will show you.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	But a mole is a small, fatty or fistulous prominence on the surface of the skin that becomes inflamed when it is attacked by the fire and appears to be mummified around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the cure for it is that you take a needle of goose quill or of vulture's feather, and make it strong, and place that on the mole so that it contains the circle of the needle in the parts of the skin; and accordingly revolve your hand with the needle until you incise what is in the circuit of the mole, and place it in the flesh of the skin, and eradicate the mole from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, do this with a needle or iron according to this form:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	Be the upper part of the needle very thin, soft (it is not perforated), wrapped so that on the said surface it learns to be ablated and the revolution of that.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you wish, cauterize the mole according to what is said before in the chapter on cauterizing in the book of medicine.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	The form of the instruments that are administered to give anointing.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes it is made anointing of silver or lead or melted iron or hammered iron; and sometimes it is made with small instruments big or small according to those which are administered, for that which is administered to the little children is small; and of those whose bottoms are rough or wrinkled, the anointings of those are small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of great and little anointing.
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The head of the needle above, in which the pouch is attached, should be wide according to this manner; and there should be a distinction at the point where the pouch is attached, just as it is sometimes.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the extremity of it below, which is inserted into the anus, should be soft (not open) like a lion's, going back to subtlety; and on one side of it there are two holes, and on the other side one hole, and the width of the hole according to the thickness of the rays and thicker by a little.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And the pouch in which medicines from the bladder of an animal or wool of a sheep are placed, and the root of it is one palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be pierced by many small holes like it is turned around; and if the space which is between the holes is as thick as said.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And accordingly insert it into those holes a strong thread of raw thread which is of ten threads or surrounds them; and adjust the pouch to that, and when the pouch is placed in it, be tight at the head of the anointing between two distinct ones with strong constriction, and accordingly anoint each hole: But the quality of anointing with that is that you fill the pouch with medicine, which should be warmed according to the quantity of the tolerance of the patient; and beware that it is not too hot nor too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And accordingly, the patient should be placed on their back with their legs elevated and a cloth spread under them, and pause below it one cushion or a bolster; and accordingly anoint the extremity of the cauterizer with oil or albumen of hen or mucilage of fenugreek or similar substances; and accordingly insert that into the anus with ease, and accordingly the attendant takes the pouch and evacuates that with two hands and samples with violence until everything in the anointing is evacuated into the bedpan; and accordingly extract the anointing and the patient raises their legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces that to happen, keep it as long as possible; and if they sleep with that for all one night, it is more likely to be a remedy.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you anoint that in the diseases of flux of the stomach and the evacuation of it is obstructed, then accordingly you will iterate the cauterizer until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if there are hemorrhoids or apostemes in the anus, then accordingly use a cauterizer that is very subtle and lion-like, from those cauterizers with which children are anointed.
De curacio de las plaguas.	The treatment of wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	And I have already said in the division of the treatment of wounds that which is fitting for a free person, and I say thus the treatment of those with me and with medicines according to their complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore I say that wounds are diversified according to this, inasmuch as they are made the wounds and according to the place on which they are placed.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes by which many times wounds are made are as follows: like a blow of a hammer, or incision with a sword or dagger, or percussion with a lance, or with a staff, or with an arrow, or similar to those of many other causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But the wounds that are on the parts of the body are as follows: like a wound that is on the head, or neck, or arms, or belly, or thigh, and similar to those of the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I recommend the treatment of some wounds by which one pauses that rationalization and rule over other wounds.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I begin with the wounds of the head, simple ones, for the recollection of the complex ones will come at the beginning of the fourth chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore I say that when a simple wound occurs on the head and is not a fracture, then consider: if it is caused by a blow of a hammer or something similar, and already the bone has been so broken that there is great swelling and you fear that an apostema may form, then you take hold of the patient's head and fleubotomize it as soon as possible, without delay; and extract from that wound as much blood as is necessary according to the quantity of the virtue of the medicine, unless there is some other cause prohibiting fleubotomy, especially if the blood that has issued from the wound is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And be the fleubotomy on the opposite side of the wounded part; and beware the patient of replenishment, and of wine and of heavy foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if some cause prohibits from the beginning, then accordingly minimize the food and do not approach meat or wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And pause over the wound if an apostema has formed cautiously, and cut in with rosy oil or wine that is stipticated.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if it is certain of an apostema cautiously, then accordingly pause over the wound, if it is recent and its air has not changed that powder which I recommend in small quantity.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that, then accordingly pause over another application until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the wound is great or caused by incision with a sword and similar things, and the lips of it are not adjusted for pulps, then accordingly adjust those with suture according to what I recommend about the suture of wounds.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the wound is already discovered to be of bone and flesh, and there is no retention of it except a small suspensori, then accordingly incise that and accordingly cure the wound with medicines and restore the flesh in its place, and command the patient to abstain from foods which are gross: heads and forms, similar to theirs, until it is composed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find in the bone putrefaction and it does not adhere to the bone, then accordingly incise all that is rotten and take out what remains, and accordingly cure what remains.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which blood flux can occur, and it is not abscessed by medicines, then accordingly inquire about the artery, and if you find that it is not incised, then accordingly incise it with a spatula or tie it off; and if necessary, provoke what we have said to not concur, then accordingly cauterize until the blood is absorbed.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these wounds are simple and small, then accordingly the cause of them is light; in such a way that you powderize on those this powder, for it consolidates before the air changes those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take one part of olive oil, two parts of dragon's blood, and three parts of non-extinguished cause; all well mixed and crushed, and fill the wound with it, and construe it with good constriction until it adheres well to that, and coagulates with the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And accordingly strengthen that above with poultices and compress it, and do not remove it until it is thus as if it were not apostemed, for the medicine is not eradicated from it until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes do this alone, when you don't have in front of you olive oil and dragon's blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And already perform this same operation on great wounds when it is necessary to pause over them and be tight, and on recent wounds with their own blood, which the air has not altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is in the time of summer, then accordingly do not think about the position of this powder, but instead cure those with what we have said, in such a way that you pause over them with certain ointments or with powders made from flour and water mixed with honey until they take on a purulent appearance; and accordingly cure those with another cure until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if there is a fracture in the bone of the wound, and it is small, then accordingly extract what remains with gentle gestures.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I will say the cure for fractures of the head in this which is poisonous.
De las plaguas del col.	Of wounds of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the wound occurs in the neck, then accordingly there is no difference in medicine and between the wound of the head when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves of the neck are cut or an artery is injured, then accordingly if it is a nerve, do not intervene with surgery but rather avoid any cure that would cause violent stiptication, such as zinnier and zegi which is vinegar and similar to theirs, because they are injurious to nerves and contract them.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not pause over the wound any cause of total numbness, for the substance of nerves is numb and their continuation is in the brain, which is the most noble part of all limbs.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if you use what is cured with light medicines, such as it being washed with lukewarm water, some times injected into rose-colored or non-rose-colored oil, and then when it is washed with lukewarm water and the other parts are minored according to this manner, and ointments moistened.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the wound is great, then accordingly administer suture, or bind the lips of it, and accordingly cure that with poultices until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the wound is deep or occurs in the lowest part of purulent matter, then accordingly pierce that in the most depressed location.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if in the wound an artery has been incised and a flux of blood has resulted, then accordingly separate or dry that, or tie off that, or cauterize that if necessary provokes at that.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the vertebrae of the spine or all have been incised and the veins of the neck are saved, then accordingly adjust the lips of the bone with suture over the canal of the spine and do not touch that; before equaling that and reducing it to its natural figure, and accordingly strengthen that with decent stricture, and leave it for a few days; and accordingly cure that with ointments in which there is stiptication and excitement until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the wound is in the bone and has made an impression, then accordingly puncture that, and if there are fragments of bone in it, extract all those that you can from them; and what is not clothed, leave that until the wound is purulent, and separate and be relieved from the excrescence.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the wound is recent, then accordingly powderize on it the powder which I have recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if in the wound there is a fistula, then accordingly cure that with what will be remembered in its own chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of wounds of the neck or similar when it is made between the vertebrae and is caused by a sword, dagger, lance, or similar.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a lance or dagger wound and the depth of the wound is considerable, then accordingly consider whether the patient has ventilation when they are lying down; accordingly know that the wound is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if the wound is not deep and the wound is recent with its own blood, then accordingly pause in it on the first hour with powder, and do not strengthen that so that the blood is not retained in the depth of the wound and returns to the heart and harms the patient; but rather pause in it with an attractive ointment, and remove it two times a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the ointment is not present, then accordingly pause in the orifice of the wound with a piece of cloth so that it sucks out what you have from the humors; and make the patient sleep over the wound so that the fluid that is there will be adjusted.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if three days or more have passed since the wound and the patient does not experience spasms, tremors of the heart, nor constriction of the armpits, and has other good dispositions towards it, then accordingly know that the wound is healed; and then cure that with poultices and another cure until it is fully healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if the healing of it is impeded and it has been open for a long time, then accordingly know that it has become a fistula; cure then that according to its own chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the wound is caused by incision of a sword or dagger and is simple in the surface of the foot or head, then accordingly cure that with what precedes suture, if it is great, or with powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if the wound has made an impression in the bone and there are pieces of bone that need to be extracted, then accordingly twist the wound and cut to extract those pieces, if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated, then accordingly leave them inside until the wound purifies, and the extraction of them is relieved.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for the other wounds that occur in the other members, the treatment in healing is the same as what we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of Wounds of the Belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition which occurs in the belly is either great, or small, or middling.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the great some times it is necessary to open or cut the budel or nerve of the budel, in order that there be an introduction of their own substance and a suture of theirs to be more violent and subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And small disruption is made difficult by another manner, and it seems that the reduction of theirs is more difficult if you do not take care to introduce their substance into its place at once, for it opens up and becomes swollen, making it difficult for the instrument to be used.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is middling, for in that there is not difficulty in reducing the budel, just as it is difficult in the two species mentioned before.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that suturing the belly is according to four manners, but two sutures are common which are necessary for suturing other wounds of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other sutures proper to it communicate with the other wounds, but are more proper in the suturing of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to you whatever exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the wound is small and there is some cause of the belly from it, and it is made difficult to reduce it, then accordingly this is in one of two ways: or by the smallness of the disruption as we have said, or when the belly has come inflated due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when this is so, accordingly it is necessary that you scrape that in such a way that you submerge a sponge or damp cloth in hot water alone, or that you gather in warm water, and cyperum, and spic, and then apply that to the belly until the inflation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes it does this with vinegar in which there is a purging quality, and it is better than hot water alone for the resolution of the inflation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see the inflation be resolved, accordingly you moisten the belly with water in which is cooked alum and meadow-sweet, because through this the instrument of it is facilitated with little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the instrument of it is excused in this cure, then accordingly you cut the disruption a little with an instrument by which they are incised and mortified.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first cure is better when it is proper and not severe, and there is no occupation to cut too much, nor to occupy oneself in cutting unnecessarily.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the Instrument: see how its shape is like this:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	The one end of it bent and acute, and the other end not acute, and the extremity subtle, and not like the subtlety of a spatula, but rather blunt by a little.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the wound is amplified and yields forth from the belly, accordingly it is necessary that its reduction be according to its natural shape, in its own proper place, if possible above all, for that is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the disruption is wide and is in the lower part of the belly, accordingly it is necessary that you make the patient lie on his back, and place his knees higher than his head; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then accordingly you place the head and legs higher than the remaining parts.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the belly, then accordingly place your intention and consideration always so that the part where the wound is may be higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus it is necessary to administer this in great wounds and middling wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small wounds, pause for that which is at your preparation, and accordingly make the minister be between your most skilled ones, who has the disruption entirely under his hand and adjusts the lips of it, and accordingly uncovers from this to that which sees some other cause for suturing.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common manner of suturing: take the needle, or count the needle according to the quantity of the amplitude of the wound; and accordingly leave it at the extremity of the disruption from the said ring finger, and strengthen the needle once, or twice, that you do not put faith in both ends of the bone, with both ends of the ciphac that is left the bone of the parties inwardly, until you make it penetrate from that part; and you have already added two ends of the bone and two ends of the ciphac, and so there are four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And accordingly strengthen it with a double thread in the circle of the needle, and sometimes of two parts together, and accordingly add the two lips and the wound by decent addition; and accordingly leave the thickness of the finger and put another needle in it, and accordingly tie that with a thread like as it was tied to the first needle; and do not cease to do this if necessary with the needles until you have completed all the contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be middling between thickness and subtlety, for the thin needles barely cut into the flesh; and the thick ones are difficult to manipulate in the bone, and therefore it is necessary that they be middling in subtlety and thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not necessary that the needle be placed in both ends of the bone proper to one, lest the flesh be barely cut and the wound be inflamed before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And there should not be prolonged suturing so that the wound is prohibited from consolidation.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And accordingly insert the ends of the needles so that they do not disturb the patient during his sleep; and place poultices spread out on all sides, which have the ends of the needles; and leave those until you know that the wound is already consolidated.
